Reviews.Title: “Needs some air”
Reviews.Author: Philatravels1016
Reviews.Content: After travelling and being awake for almost 40 hours - I was looking forward to getting a nap in my room at 4 pm. I got an interior room which faced a cement wall with a window that doesn't open. It was unseasonably warm at the end of March 2012 - my room was like a hot closet. When I asked them to fix the air conditioning which I assumed was broken - I found out the air had not been turned on in the entire building...yet. And they couldn't turn it on, nor could they provide a fan. I was told it would get cooler at nighttime when I "should" be going to sleep. I was able to switch my room to the street side with windows that would open - but it was very noisy. AND - it was over 55% more expensive than the room that I originally booked. The staff is friendly and the bell boy was particularly helpful in moving my room for a second time. But I agree with a prior review that the place is dated, the location is great - but if I could have switched hotels without a penalty - I would have definitely done so.

Reviews.Title: “Breathless in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen L
Reviews.Content: We spent Easter weekend, April 8 2012, in Barcelona and chose the Hotel Roger de Lluria specifically for it's quiet side street location. We had a gorgeous family room, with 2 of the largest beds I've seen in Europe and my daughter had a twin in a small somewhat secluded area of her own. The staff upgraded us, and even tho the view was of the backs of apartments, it was never noisy. The staff truly make this hidden gem the place to stay. The front desk staff, Christina and Massihmo were friendly, helpful and efficient in helping us plot the best way to see and eat our way thru Barcelona. After long days of sightseeing and dragging back to the hotel, Lungani was waiting with his magical bar touch and excellent service. Hotel is intimate, staff knew our names and always asked about our day and truly cared about our experience. Hotel is a few blocks from metro and La Rambla, but we never missed the crowds or traffic at this perfect hotel location-as well all restaurant recommendations were spot on! This will be our go-to hotel in the future! Many thanks to you all for making our trip wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, Fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Johanna M
Reviews.Content: Our family recently stayed here while visiting our daughter who is an exchange student in Barcelona. The rooms were lovely, neat and clean and because we were on the 5th floor each room had a patio with lounge chairs and a dining set. We felt it was a good location--central enough, only 3 streets form the Ramblas ,but away from the noise and hustle of a main street which was perfect as we were there during one Barcelona's labor "strikes." The staff was absolutely wonderful. They helped us many times with recommendations, directions and reservations. They always bid us a good day when we set out for our adventures and welcomed us back when we returned. Christina was especially nice and very patient with our endless questions and attempts at the Spanish language. She even offered to help our daughter if she needed it during the rest of her stay. (She is still in Barcelona in an apartment for the remainder of her semester abroad.) We did eat breakfast at the hotel each day because it was included with our price and it was very good with fresh fruit each day and a wide variety of American and European choices on the buffet. We highly recommend this hotel and truly enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Really average...”
Reviews.Author: trvlrOrlando_FL
Reviews.Content: 3 star hotel and I was somewhat disappointed as Barcelona is an amazing city and deserves a better hotel stay. However, I had pre-paid through AMEX and was unable to switch places. Location is good and some of the staff do try their best to provide great service but the rooms are dated and the overall feeling gets impacted. There was nothing here that would make me come back. If you are on a budget this may be the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “I want a comfortable bed and pillow when I travel.”
Reviews.Author: Bentle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice enough and very friendly front desk staff, but the bed that we had was not comfortable at all. I woke up with a back ache all 3 mornings which was not the case at the other 3 hotels that we stayed in Europe on this vacation. It wasn't a cheap hotel, and not extremely convenient to the main sightseeing sites. I would probably stay closer to Barcelona port next time I go to Barcelona. The bathrooms are extremely nice and updated, but the rest of the hotel is very old timey look. We had an awful interior view out our window of I guess local residences with clothes hanging out on balconies or (clothes lines) to dry. Free wi-fi which is a big bonus when traveling from the US. We paid a lot per night for a triple room, in my opinion, for what we got. Booked with a travel agent may have been tge reason.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem in a prime location!”
Reviews.Author: bn1511
Reviews.Content: A gem of a find, in the centrally located L'Eixample, minutes away from Placa Catalunya! I'm usually a chain hotel kind of person since I covet those hotel points :) For this trip of Barcelona, I decided to go smaller and found this place through Kayak. I made reservations directly on the hotel's website and the experience from that point on has been nothing but flawless! Days after my reservation, the manager contacted me via e-mail to welcome me (more than 40 days in advance of my visit). They contacted me again closer to the stay to ask about transportation from the airport. I had already made arrangements but was highly impressed by this attention to detail. Check-in was pleasant - everybody speaks fluent English!! They had my room ready at 10 AM which was a blessing since I could immediately go freshen up from the long flight and hit the streets for some sightseeing :) The room was on the smallish side but for a European hotel, it was generous. Bathroom was extremely spacious and well stocked with amenities. The room was beautifully appointed and the minibar well stocked. Prices for the minibar items were also very reasonable. Bed was very comfortable. I found it hard to figure out the ventilation and air conditioning because regardless of what I set the temperature at, the room always seemed a bit too warm for me. But I'd rather be a bit on the warmer side than being cold so no worries :) Great service too - housekeeping was not at all intrusive but did a thorough job. I did not have any meals at the restaurant so cannot rate the food or service there. Checkout was a breeze - the credit card machine was broken at checkout and I did not want to go get cash so they just had me sign a piece of paper authorizing a charge. So much trust!! And they sent me an e-mailed invoice that I had in my inbox before I got back home - very efficient!! I would heartily recommend this boutique hotel for its location, cleanliness and great rooms, fantastic and friendly service - this is a hidden gem so make the most of it :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: arrosen
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this charming hotel. The rooms are very clean, nicely appointed, and somewhat large for a European hotel. The bathroom is large and stocked with all sorts of toiletries. The beds are comfortable, the television is a new flat screen with lots of viewing options, and the wireless internet is free. The front desk staff are extremely nice and accomodating - whatever you need, they will get it for you. The breakfast is just fair, but sufficient. The best part of this hotel, however, is the location. It is on a quiet street, just 2 blocks from Placa Catalunya and La Rambla. When I go back to Barcelona, this hotel will be my first choice!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: lumamahdi
Reviews.Content: Good location near Palaza de Catalunya, a walking distance from Casa Battlo ana La Pedrera, near La Ramblas and the metro. Staff very friendly and helpful and they try their best to assist you. Price wise, it's a but pricy if you are looking for hotel to sleep only in your busy schedule in Barcelona .

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: KMG4YL3
Reviews.Content: Just back from my third trip to this hotel with friends. As before, I could not fault the service we received. The staff are the hotel's greatest asset. They treated us like old friends! The Bar man and reception staff deserve special praise. Its difficult to think of staying anywhere else in Barcelona. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Travelers0076
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and it was a good location on a quiet street in Barcelona. The staff was very accommodating and friendly as well as helpful. The lobby was beautiful and rooms were average. Definitely older and a bit smaller than expected but it's Europe. We did not eat breakfast at the hotel but found cute bakeries and restaurants with wonderful breakfasts. The air conditioning worked well and the room was good as we were traveling with our two little ones so their bed and crib was in an alcove. Overall a lovely stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, excellent location, great city”
Reviews.Author: MAGCaerdydd
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short break in Barcelona staying at the Hotel Roger De Lluria. On our arrival we were told that we had been upgraded to a “Superior” room which meant that we had a jacuzzi bath and a balcony – the latter was very handy for the early morning cigarette! The location of the hotel is excellent – very central and in a nice area. The room was well appointed and very clean and the staff were, without exception, particularly pleasant and helpful. One morning we left a considerable sum of money on the bed by mistake and we were both relieved and impressed when we found, on returning to our room hours later, that it had been placed safely on the bedside table for us. We will certainly return to Barcelona and this will be our first choice of hotel. It is worth taking the tourist bus (tickets can be bought at the hotel at a small discount) and visiting Parc Güell (Blue Line), especially on a sunny day. Get off a few stops later at the Sarrià district (round about 1.30pm if possible) and walk down to Bar-Restaurante Can Tomàs for a surreal experience of the best “patates braves” and “patates amb alioli” in Barcelona. We would also recommend L’Antiquari, a bar close to the cathedral in the Barri Gòtic (opens round about 3 pm) for the excellent atmosphere. Try visiting La Boqueria market as well – the fruit and veg displays are amazing! Climbing Columbus’ column (in Port Vell at the bottom of La Rambla) and a trip on the Golondrinas boat (on a sunny day if possible!) are good ways of seeing the city from a different perspective.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth L
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience in this hotel. It has an old world feeling but with modern amenities. We arrived early and had to wait a little for our room, but they did manage to get it ready as fast as possible. The reception staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast is pricey, but it is good. The bathroom was beautiful and was well stocked with toiletries, The location of this hotel is excellent. It is on a quiet street, but is walking distance from many of the tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “Classic comfort and great location”
Reviews.Author: Simmobrizzy
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights in this very good hotel which is ideally located as a good central base in the city. 5 - 10 minutes walk to Placa de Catalunya and Las Ramblas and the start of Passeig de Gracia. The nearest subway is Urquinaona or Catalunya, so really easy to get around. Buy a day ticket for Zone 1, more than 2 trips and you save money, although most of the time we walked around the city!!. Getting to and from the airport, we went for a taxi which cost 25 euro on Monday but beware the trip back on a Sunday afternoon cost 48 euro (different rate for weekend or was it a rip-off??). If you don't have much luggage the airport bus goes to/from Placa de Catalunya and cost a lot less! The street the hotel is in gets quite a bit of traffic but we had a room at the front on the second floor and were not bothered once by the noise. The room was excellent, a good size with a king-size bed with firm mattress, and generally well furnished. The bathroom was also a good size, good amenities and an excellent shower over the bath. Minibar was reasonable but the lack of tea and coffee making (like most Spanish hotels) facilities wasn't a problem as we had been forewarned by an earlier review and took a small heating element and a couple of mugs! The service from Reception was great - friendly, helpful and excellent English - very good from booking the open-top city tour bus (2 euro discount getting the ticket this way) to numerous restaurant reccommendations and help on the train timetable to Figueres to vist the Dali museum - a nice day trip, by the way. Can't comment on breakfast as we went out every day. A few places we ate which we would reccomend were; on the same street, Roger de Lluria 6 (towards Urquinaona) was Casa Alfonso (traditional), Restaurant Barceloneta down by the marina for great seafood, and a couple of tapas bars - Ciudad Condal (Rambla de Catalunya 18) and Costa Gallega (on Passeig de Gracia 71). A great place for coffee and croissant was two doors before the Casa Alfonso. If you see nothing else, visit the Sagrada Familia - it is simply extraordinary. Casa Batllo is a Gaudi classic, walk down Las Ramblas, visiting the Boqueria market on the right which is fascinating and El Born on the left including the Picasso museum. The Fundacio Joan Miro is also well worth a visit if you are into art. Enjoy Barca, it's a great city!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: LovinTheJourney
Reviews.Content: We had a one night stay before catching a cruise to the Canary Islands. This hotel is a very beautiful European hotel. The location is great for walking to many nearby points of interest. The room itself was much larger than most other European hotels for the same price and the decor was very lovely. The bathroom was also roomy and very well appointed. There were lots of amenities. The staff was very friendly and helped us find what we were looking for in a restaurant nearby. We had a lovely evening walking to a bustling shopping area with lots of great choices for eating from tapas bars to formal. We also found several cathedrals close by to visit. We were also helped to get a taxi right on time the next morning to take us to the cruise ship. We would most certainly stay at this hotel again and will recommend it to anyone lucky enough to visit beautiful Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and well-kept accommodation, great location”
Reviews.Author: judyisreadytogo
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a pleasant stay here. Hotel staff was very helpful. The room and bathroom were both large. There was a large dressing area/foyer, which expanded the available space. Carpet was thin and a bit worn, but acceptable to us. Our room was on the front of the hotel, and it was a bit noisy early one of the mornings. Otherwise, we didn't notice it. The location was great -- just off Placa Catalunya. Close to shopping, restaurants and many sights. Just down the street from the architectural triumphs of Gaudi. We walked most of the time; when it was too far to walk, it was easy to hop on the subway or a bus. Very close to the airport bus stop. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, "standard", good location”
Reviews.Author: Nicolai L
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel in the end of August 2011. Everything worked "as it should". The hotel itself was very clean and comfortable, and the style is very classic. The staff was friendly, helpful and professional. I think this would be a great hotel on business. For a romantic stay it was very good also, but no "charm". All in all we had a very nice stay, and I have nothing bad to say about it.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay in a classical hotel”
Reviews.Author: KellyVGr
Reviews.Content: during october ,we had a mini journey, 4day trip to Barcelona. The hotel is very classy and has everything you need. it is not my style, i am more a modern furnishing type,but had no complains. Spanish people are generally polite and speak english,the staff was kind and helpful. i really liked that is in the centre, outside the hotel few meters down there 's a tram station and also there s a connection some meters up and right. Barcelona is amazing, all day we were out and had sightseeing. the hotel is for sure a safe choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good and centrally located hotel i Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Frode L
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife spent a weekend at this hotel. Great service, smiling staff. The hotel is not new, and the rooms and decor has an old 'style', but the property seems well maintained and has modern amenities. Our room had a nice flatscreen tv on the wall f.ex. The hotel is located 3 blocks from Placa Catalunya, and is in walking distance of nice shopping areas and Las Ramblas. We also walked to La Sagrada Familia which is about 12-15 blocks away. We like to walk.

Reviews.Title: “A five-star hotel, in our book - a great stay in this lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maryjudy
Reviews.Content: We found everything about the Hotel Roger de Lluria completely to our liking, during our recent eight-day stay. (This is saying alot, as I am a higher-maintenance, fussy older person, with issues like claustrophobia, light sleep, etc. - so not easy to please). We had no problems with noise from the street - we were on the fifth floor and our room was quiet with the doors closed. The location of this hotel was perfect, in a great area close to the Barri Gotic and the L’Eixample districts - a couple of blocks walk to Placa de Catalunya and Placa Urquinaona, close to three metro stops and to many restaurants and shops, across the street from a pharmacy and (diagonally to) a well stocked grocery store. Our room was extremely comfortable - the bed and bedding were great, bathroom (especially bathtub) spacious, we loved the walk-out terrace and other amenities. All the staff we interacted with was very helpful and kind. We thank in particular Massimo and Hakim for making sure we had everything we needed, and that we knew where to go and how to get there. The housekeeping staff was exceptionally attentive and detailed. The food on the breakfast buffet was fresh, high quality and plentiful, and we enjoyed the eggs made to order. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to Barcelona; we hope to go back, and especially, to the Hotel Roger de Lluria.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JackieCowan
Reviews.Content: This was our 9th trip to Barcelona (our daughter lives there) and this was by far the best hotel we've stayed at. I can only fully endorse all the positive reviews this hotel has received. The rooms are lovely & extremely well maintained. The staff were welcoming, friendly & most helpful. The location brilliant, near the airport bus stop, the Metro & most of the main attactions. We have booked to go back in March.

Reviews.Title: “Smart Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: oldbobj
Reviews.Content: So we took on this hotel on the recommendation of our travel agent who likes us to be comfortable in the big cities. Arriving late at night we had an easy and friendly check-in, so easy that we chose to head out for a late night tapas and canya (beer) tasting and were landed with heaps of great ideas and possibilities by the late night staff who had great english and were making sure we got the best first impressions! We stayed in 2 different rooms as we headed out of town for a couple of days in between and it was no hassle to leave luggage there. Both rooms were good sized with big bathrooms and a bit of a view for each. Brekky is simple but a good start for hitting the streets to get your Gaudi fix nearby. While in hindsight we would have preferred to have lived the old barrio experience a little more for the heritage and culture, we couldnt fault what was a good location for heading in any direction for time-strapped tourists. We would definitely recommend nearby Casa Alfonso for a traditional restaurant experience (complete with stately owner sitting nearby watching to ensure the experience was a good one) and Piscolabis for great atmosphere at the tapas bar - not cheap but plenty of action for people watching.

Reviews.Title: “cozy, friendly hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: batya p
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Roger de Lluria hotel in Barcelona. Staff is extremely helpful , eager to help and give tips. The hotel is cozy, comfortable, pleasant and clean. The rooms are large. Breakfast was not included, but we tried one morning and it was simple but tasty. The location is great. Only a few blocks from the main attractions such as the Rambla & Gothic Quarter. Metro & bus are nearby. We highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Best location, Excellent reception staff”
Reviews.Author: ali_o_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed ( myself and two adults sons ) at the Roger de Lluria From oct 27 to oct 31 . We were very happy we chose this hotel. Location is excellent Catalunya, the Ramblas Is just 2 blocks away One metro station is 2 minutes away and the Catalunya plaza metro is 4 minutes away. Restaurants, cafeterias, cafes, groceries shops and bars are all around you. From the catalunya plaza you can catch the airport bus and all tours buses. Location is very safe we had no problem walking back at night. Check in and out was very fast and easy. The front desk staff are the best. They are very nice and very helpful, They will answer all your questions and give all the information you need. They make you feel welcome all the time and will great every time you pass by and ask you how was your day. Thank you. The hotel room was clean comfortable and spacious for 3 adults. We had 2 twin beds and one single bed which was very comfortable. The WiFi was free excellent and fast. There was enough towels, soaps, jells, and shampoo to accommodate 3 adults. There is a safe big to fit a lap top, a big TV with English and Spanish channels . I wish they had coffee making utensils . it would have been perfect.. I will go back to this hotel and I recommend it to all visitors to Barcelona. . .

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: toalt2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days in October and were very pleased. Some of the higher rated TA choices were booked or could not accommodate our party of 3, but we ended up loving the hotel, excellent location, and great service. It really could be rated higher in our opinion! It was 2 blocks to Plaza Catalunya, the Ramblas and the Gothic quarter. Just as close were some of the Gaudi sites in the Eixample. The hotel was clean, roomy and the bathroom large. High marks go to the reception desk, always helpful and with a smile! One gentleman even walked me to the corner to help me use the Caixa to retrieve our tickets. Overall, very comfortable and great value!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location near restaurants, the main square and tourist sites”
Reviews.Author: Marguerite R
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10 days - the hotel was clean, comfortable, wonderful and helpful staff. Breakfast was included and although it never changed, it was quite adequate with eggs, bacon, toast, cereal, fruit, juice, fish and sweets. There is a small bar area but no lunch/dinner restaurant tho they do have room service. The only thing that would have made it a 5 star for us would have been a restaurant and an outside patio area to read.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good service, very traditional”
Reviews.Author: elfarolillo
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this hotel and overall we were very pleased with our choice. The next metro station is one minute away and the huge Plaza Catalunya right next to the famous Ramblas and Old Town is within a five minutes walk. The hotel itself is very old-fashioned with some antique aspects, but overall it achieves a good level of quality. Staff is very friendly, breakfast is huge and the rooms are very clean. What wasn't so great: The TV didn't work for some channels and the shower could have used a makeover.

Reviews.Title: “5 night stay”
Reviews.Author: raykhjane
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly suprised by the standard of this well located hotel, good standard all round. room very clean and all the usual amenities in place Breakfast buffet very good Staff were excellent Bar closed at 11.00 pm but barman stayed on if required, he seemed to care about his customers, how unusual.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: bakem
Reviews.Content: Not quite a five star hotel - if you can excuse the mould on the walls, and the cigarette butts on the patio (we are non smokers). Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful - buffet breakfast was great. Location was good - just off La Ramblas - 2 blocks walk. We were upgraded to a family room, however I wouldnt have seen this as an upgrade for what we booked and paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Super place to stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Millie087
Reviews.Content: Just back from a three day break in Barcelona. I was delighted that I picked this hotel. It is in a very convenient and safe location - no problem walking back at night. When we arrived we got a free upgrade - very large bedroom at the front of the building - superking bed, two balconies, TVs in bedroom and bathroom, two big armchairs, lots of space, whirlpool bath, power shower and an array of toiletries. Great selection of food for breakfast in a large dining room - go early for the bacon and eggs. What makes it special though are the staff particularly the front desk team - they could not have been nicer - cheerful, helpful and very welcomimg from the time I booked until we left. I thought we got very good value for money. The hotel is really quiet at night which is great because there is so much to do in Barcelona you really appreciate a good night's sleep in a comfortable bed. The hotel is about a five minute walk from Catalunya so you can easily get a bus from the airport and walk to the hotel. All in all a great experience and I would go back in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, helpful staff, bit pricey for accommodations”
Reviews.Author: algis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here post cruise to explore this beautiful city. The masterful works by Gaudi especially the Familia Sagrada whose interior evoked a forest of branching columns reaching for heaven, allowed for peaceful solitude and reflection, despite the masses of visitors. As for the hotel, it's location is it's best attribute. Our room had a small balcony but was closed in by a high wall facing both the street as well as the neighboring rooms. The sink in our room had to be repaired twice due to faulty drain, which we eventually removed by hand...the shower was also problematic, with a 'half window splash door' provided for a hand held shower ??? Try doing your back with the hand held without 'showering' the floor... Breakfast was nominal for the price, ask for an jambon/queso omelet, tasty ! Another positive attribute is it"s proximity to the Plaza Cataluniya and the Aero Bus which will transport you and your luggage to BCN for 5.6 Euros vs 60 Euro for a cab... check your TA locator for restaurants nearby if you have free WiFi access as this hotel provides. Oh, and advice for BCN, go shopping on the main floor BEFORE you pass thru security on the second floor...as there are only TWO duty free shops once you enter the secure zone, one can then only wistfully observe the multitude of shops from the secure balcony....

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: beachiemom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roger de Lluria for four nights before our Mediterranean cruise this summer. We are a family of four and were a bit surprised when we checked into the "family room" that it only had one extra large bed! The room was small, and we all four fit (two adults, two teen daughters), but it made for an interesting start to our vacation! Breakfast was included each morning. It was a typical European breakfast w/meats, cheeses, and breads offered. The location was good. We did a lot of walking, and felt the hotel was centrally located. The staff were very helpful and friendly. We don't speak much spanish, but had no problems w/communication. Barcelona is a beautiful city! I would recommend this, but maybe not the "family room" for a family of four!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect holiday”
Reviews.Author: Corina H
Reviews.Content: I did choose the hotel based on the reviews on this site and it was the best choice I could have made. The hotel is located in a very central position but also in a quite street, which does allow easy access to metro, a lot of walking in this beautiful and well-organized city but also a very good rest. The hotel staff is genuine kind, very helpful in making your trip a real success by making good suggestions, helping you find different locations (map included), helping you make the arrangements you need to do what ever you would like to do etc. Considering the excellent experience I have had I am definitely going to return to Barcelona and stay at Roger de Lluria.

Reviews.Title: “Will return again!”
Reviews.Author: KMG4YL3
Reviews.Content: Another great stay at Roger de Lluria. We opted for bed and breakfast, which was so plentiful that we only ever needed a snack in the afternoon. The hotel staff could not have been more helpful and pleasant. They suggested some fantastic restaurants, all within 10 minutes walk. Steak at the Argentinian restaurant around the corner was truly memorable. We spent a few days at the beach, which was only three stops on the metro (avoid Barcelonetta and get off at the next stop - Ciutadella Vila Olimpica - for a much more pleasant beach experience). On one day we took a local bus to Montjuic and got the cable car down to the beach. The views of Barcelona were spectacular, but the cable car is not for the fainthearted! Overall, a superb trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Quiet and walking distance to all sites”
Reviews.Author: travbud1
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel. The location is 5 minutes or so away from La Rambla and Gaudi's works so it is both quiet and well located. I don't know that this hotel does anything especially well, but is fine. Again for its cost it is fairly well priced for Barcelona and there are many other expensive options. The room is nice but could be updated. The staff are friendly. There is a very slow computer in the lobby. I struggled to find a hotel that I wanted in Barcelona. This hotel met but did not exceed my expectations. I would neither recommend nor advise against staying here, but it was a perfectly fine place to stay both for location and transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Location + Service= great stay”
Reviews.Author: 1Bull
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 1st of Sept for 8 nights.We selected this hotel based on T/A reviews. The location was perfect,away from the crowded tourist areas but only a 8-10 minute walk to Passieg de Gracia. The staff was very helpful with suggestions. Many restaurants are close by. We would definitely stay there again. 1bull

Reviews.Title: “Great location , comfortable, safe hotel”
Reviews.Author: GypsyChicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed here early September and were very pleased with our accomodations. We were pleasantly surprised to find out that it was only a few blocks from Las Ramblas main shopping and hotel strip so we enjoyed all the perks of the neighborhood without having to deal with the noise when it was time to go to bed. We had a room with a simple terrace that overlooked Roger De Lluria avenue. I would recommend this to anyone if staying for any longer that a couple of nights. The bathroom is ample size for American travellers. I have been to many European hotels to be disappointed with the bathrooms. Maybe being an American I have higer expectations in this regard, but this hotel does not disappoint for any traveller. The hotel is two blocks from the Passieg de Gracia metro stop in the Eixample district so you are able to access all metro lines via this station. Price equals value for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An overall positive experience”
Reviews.Author: TheClintons
Reviews.Content: Barcelona was the final stage in our four city tour (Rome, Taormina, Granada, Barcelona) and we spent 5 nights in Hotel Roger de Lluria. Our trip was a mixture of conference tourism and family vacation (my wife, our 9 yr old daughter and myself). I choose the Hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and I think it was a good choice. We arrived before check-in time but there was a room available for us immediately. What is more, they upgraded us to a delux room which was a nice surprize. The receptionist were very frienly which is mostly nice except if you are waiting to checkin and the receptionist is chitchatting for 5 min with 2 ladys about their beach experience in Barcelona even after he explained in most detail how to get to new beaches. (By the way walk down to the sea and start walking in any direction. It is that easy). But the good point was that they were very friendly with us, too and our light anger evaporated after they decided to pay us a little attention and checked us in. The room was nice overlooking the street with 2 balconies. WiFi was free and fast! Our first experience with breakfast was weird. They ran out of everything and we had to wait 5-10 min to get things restocked. Restarant staff (one lady cleaning up the tables and one trying to restock the food.) was very slow and they both looked as if they lost at least 2 or 3 close family members on one day. Even though there were never more than 10 people in the small restaurant they could not cope with the easy task of refilling stuff so at least half of the things were constantly out of stock.. Interestingly this changed from the second day on: still few guests in the restaurants but the new staff (1-2 new waiters and 1 new lady restocking) managed to run things smoothly. I still find it quite puzzling why they serve coffee (and milk) in 2 small pitchers (not holding more than 1 liter) for the whole restaurant rather than 1 pitcher per table or at least a good size coffee container as in all other hotels. I did not like to reuse my fork and knife several times for salmon and salty things and sweet stuff but I had to as they never gave us new ones except for a spoon which we did not need. As for the food, it was a nice selection (even salmon!) and higher quality food than in the previous hotels we stayed in. One of the best things about the hotel was its location. Close to La Rambla (5 min walk) close to the metro (3 min walk to reach the yellow line, L4 that took us to the conference center in the outskirts of Barcelona without the need to change to an other line)

Reviews.Title: “Ola Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: jacksondlz
Reviews.Content: Our room was in a great location. The room was FABULOUS with a lovely balcony overlooking the quaint streets of Barcelona. One thing that still stands out in our minds is the OUTSTANDING breakfast! Oh my!! Who would think of a tuna sandwich for breakfast but do not miss this! Plus all of the other food was over the top good! The staff were friendly and helpful and we had such a good time we plan on going back and staying there. A must!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and Well Located, but not a first class hotel - Avoid breakfast”
Reviews.Author: pickynotsnooty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located next to a deluxe hotel, and we heard that at one point they were a single property. Roger de Lluria is close to the Plaza Catalunya and certainly at the center of tourist Barcelona. We stayed in the family room, which is a spacious suite. The room was a nice suite, but the bathroom was in need of updating. The "spa tub" didn't function as it should have. The staff were friendly and helpful. Considering the price we paid (through yeego dot com), we were pleased with this clean and faux-elegant property. However, if someone is looking for a first clas hotel, this is not even close to that. The one disappointment in an overall pleasant 3-night stay was the hotel breakfast, which was a grossly overpriced buffet in a stuffy and poorly decorated room. It is an absolute ripoff, so breakfast elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Large room and great service”
Reviews.Author: TwoPotScreamer
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in a large room with a terrace on the 5th floor. It was the best room for a comparable rate during a 4 week trip in Italy, France and Spain. Room has entry area with a desk, large bathroom with a bath and plenty of space around the bed in the main room. Free wifi available in the room. The safe was big enough to fit a small laptop. Great welcoming service from staff. Walking distance to Placa Catalunya and metro stations.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel In BCN”
Reviews.Author: Fg82
Reviews.Content: Central location is a plus. Busy street, mediocre service. Rooms are clean and relatively large for Europe stds. Overall had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Frances5419
Reviews.Content: My husband, myself and our son stayed here on our first ever visit to Barcelona, and found it so close to most of the attractions, and for some of the others we used the hop on hop off bus. When we arrived at the hotel our rooms were not ready, which was ok because we were a little too early for the check in time, but when the gentleman at the reception told me where our rooms were situated i got a little worried, because they were a little too far away from each other, and i told him that i had requested our rooms to be beside each other in an e-mail which i had sent to the hotel at the time of booking, luckily he was able to give us the rooms beside each other, the only downside to that was, we had to wait a little longer before we could eventually get into our rooms. We had breakfast included in our stay, and the first morning it was really nice, but the next morning it was not so good, the scrambled egg didn't look or smell the best and the sausages were not fully cooked, so after that we decided to have the cornflakes, cold meats. tomatoes, toast and coffee and a small portion of the rasher for breakfast, and it was really filling, a good start for the day. Apart from the breakfast episode, everything else was good, the front desk staff were very pleasant, and helpful "except the gentleman that we met on our first day", and the turn down service in the evening was a lovely touch, especially the chocolates that the girl left on the bed arranged in such a nice way. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: 86Lisa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Roger de Lluria early August and I can't speak highly enough of the staff there. Especially Cristina and Hakim, both were exceptionally helpful and more than happy to assist with any query or request we had. From directions around town to recommending hotels and shops. The hotel rooms were great, we had a very spacious room with elegant bathroom. Very comfortable and tasteful. Breakfast was more than enough with great choice. The area is safe and within 15 minutes walk of Picasso museum and the gothic centre. Would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Placa Catalunya and Las Ramblas”
Reviews.Author: Famluv2travel
Reviews.Content: Extremely helpful front desk and staff. We were upgraded to a large family suite. Room was very large by European standards and the bathroom had a large whirlpool bathtub which after a long hot day of sightseeing was a real treat! Market and cafe real close for purchasing snacks and food. Taxis are right outside. Walking distance to high end stores and Gaudi buildings. Again, great location to go in any direction to visit Barcelona. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Almost worth a 4 star rating but not quite”
Reviews.Author: MD1Bristol_UK
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in mid-August on room only basis. The hotel is in an excellent central location, close enough to most things but in a relatively quiet street. Barcelona is made for walking and lots of major sites are within a 30 minute stroll. There are also numerous restaurants and bars within a 10 minute walk. The staff are friendly, speak excellent English and are helpful with recommendations for excursions and eating out. The rooms (1 double, 1 single) were large and well equipped, in fact the single was really a small double, beds were very comfortable. What stops me from giving it a solid four star rating is a few niggles. The bar is devoid of any character and not somewhere you will want to linger over a pre or post dinner drink. The bar is mainly used as an area to access the hotel's free wi-fi which only covers the immediate bar area, so no access in hotel rooms. The bathrooms had the odd stray hair in them on arrival but housekeeping was exemplary from then on. One room was on the fifth floor next to housekeeping and below the terrace and occasionally very loud crashes would be heard as staff (or elephants) went about their business. I didn't feel any of these warranted a complaint to management but in my mind they cost the hotel a 'Very Good' rating. If you want somewhere pleasant to rest your head at a reasonable price while making the most of what Barcelona has to offer I'd recommend this hotel. If you're likely to be spending a fair bit of time in your hotel I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: OneGrandWhim
Reviews.Content: We'vejust returned from an extended stay in Barcelona and the Med. We stayed at the Roger De Lluria for 3 nights prior and 3 nights after our cruise. The location can not be beat. In a quiet residential neighborhood yet so close to restaurants and all the must see Barcelona sites. Safety - a key issue for our family of 4 including 2 teenage girls - was never an issue - and we walked late into the evenings (before midnight). The rooms were more than adequate and on the occassion when something needed to be addressed - if was done so w/in minutes! The staff - well that's the best part of this exceptional value. We spent great times chatting with both Hakim and Angelica who advised on dining, beaches and also solicited feedback from us on our thoughts. We would absolutely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ithaca12
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my stay, travelled alone to the beautiful Barcelona. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Location was also convenient as it's walking distance to Plaza Catalunya. Quiet area despite being in the city center. Had a great dinner just nearby the hotel, great paella and Sangria! I booked a singl room, quite surprisingly small, with a single bed which fits the small room into it's walls, so not much space to move around. Bathroom size wAs spacious. Haven't seen their double room, might be better. Overall a good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: wdw4me
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Roger De Lluria in Barcelona prior to embarking on a cruise. Upon arriving to the hotel we were immediately impressed by the cleanliness of both the lobby area and the room. We reserved a 'family room' and were very impressed by the size, especially compared to other European rooms we have stayed in. The room had very nice toiletries including not only the standard soap, shampoo, etc. but also a toothbrush and other similar extras. The hotel was a convenient walk to most of the attractions we had hoped to see including the Sagrada Familia (about a 25 minute walk), Las Ramblas (about 10 minutes), Placa de Catalunya, etc. There was an excellent restaurant just across the street (Grand Foc) which opened at 7pm each night and had delicious Sangria! We did not have breakfast at the hotel as we had read so many negative reviews about it. While the staff was very friendly, we didn't quite experience it to the same level as other reviewers. We did have one experience where the front desk associate spoke to another employee about us in Spanish, assuming we didn't speak the language (which we do). That was upsetting and honestly left us with a bad impression. We also did not feel that they were very interested in helping us to navigate the city, giving limited information about how to reach certain destinations and even sending us to a local cafe for breakfast where no one spoke any English (remember they assumed we spoke only English) and where the service was not good. We did have prompt service late in the evening when we requested an extra towel, which was excellent. Considering the price we paid, the location, the cleanliness, and the room size, I would definitely recommend staying at the Hotel Roger De Lluria. You will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sinho H
Reviews.Content: All staffs are very kind. Very nice hotel. We would like to come again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: This is definitly a 4 star hotel. Great room with good service. Located in the Eixample area, it is easy to get to Las Ramblas and only a couple of blocks from the metro. The breakfast was good, the breakfast room was great. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel near Placa de Catalunya”
Reviews.Author: sfjon4
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a lovely, spacious room with two double beds and a jacuzzi bathtub, which was wonderful following a long day of touring around the city. However, I don't think the jacuzzi tubs are common in this hotel. The hotel is only a few short blocks from Plaza de Catalunya, a very central spot in the city, and an easy place to catch the hop on hop off buses we used to get around Barcelona. Subway connections are nearby as well. The staff was very nice and spoke English well enough. Our only negative comment is that the breakfast was very pricey, more than twice what was charged by comparable hotels we stayed at in Madrid and Dublin on the same vacation, so we never took advantage of it. It might have been spectacular, but given the number of take-out or eat-in breakfast options along the walk from the hotel to Placa de Catalunya, we opted for that approach. We did not get to see other room configurations to know if others are as generously proportioned as our room was, so be sure you investigate that if you are opting for a different number of beds.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding”
Reviews.Author: pert_11
Reviews.Content: Splendid location, quiet street within ten minutes walk of La Catalunya. Our six night stay was enhanced by Receptionist Cristina, gracious, well informed, efficient and personable.

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Christine_684
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after our ship disembarked in Barcelona. We stayed in the suite~ it was a beautiful room and enough room for our 2 teenage sons and us. I would highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “The most helpful, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Tictoc8B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Roger de Lluria for 4 days. The room was clean & spacious for our family of 4. The location is perfect located close to various public transportation options. The people that are employed there were so friendly, always greeting us upon arrival back from a day of sight seeing and taking interest in what we did. They guided and directed us in navigating the beautiful, clean and friendly city of Barcelona! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in all of Europe”
Reviews.Author: chutzler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the opportunity to stay at Hotel Roger de Lluria before and after we boarded our 11 day Mediterranean Cruise. Everything about this hotel was a wonderful experience! This hotel stay came after we traveled to Paris, Venice, Florence and Rome as we enjoyed a once-in-a-life vacation throughout our favorite cities in Europe. At each of these tourist cities, we stayed at hotels that were equally priced in similar touristy areas to Hotel Roger de Lluria. By far, the hotel staff and the accommodations at Hotel de Lluria were FAR SUPERIOR! We were pleasantly greeted by a front-desk staff member named Cristina that turned out to be absolutely INCREDIBLE! She greeted us with a welcoming smile and was able to check us in early on both occasions (before and after our cruise). This VIP level treatment never happened at any other hotel we stayed at all throughout Europe. After settling into our spacious room, she spent at least 45 minutes with us explaining the best sights to see in Barcelona and the best restaurants to visit. Her advice proved to be right on! My wife and I saw some of the most incredible sites and ate some of the most amazing food during our short stay in Barcelona, thanks to Cristina. If we ever make it back to Barcelona, my wife and I will definitely stay at this hotel again. It is so centrally located to the sites of Barcelona and the staff is incomparable. Look no further...Hotel Roger de Lluria is where you want to stay if you're looking for an unforgettable experience!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: J_Dalton
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 days in Barcelona at Hotel Roger de Lluria and, for our first visit to Barcelona, we couldn't have chosen a better hotel. It was a quick walk to Las Rambla without the night noise to interfere with sleep. The hotel had all the amenities of a 5 star hotel and a breakfast that could sustain us till we were ready to stop for sangria and tapas later in the day. But the best part about this hotel was the warm, personal, friendly customer service. Applause to Enric, the hotel manager, on having an entire staff that seems to give 100 per cent! On the day we arrived, when Enric found out this was our first time to Barcelona, he sat down at a table with us and a map and spent a good half hour making sure we were aware of all Barcelona had to offer. It seemed that each day we needed some kind of help(computers, restaurant recommendation, reservations, tickets, guides). Everyone on staff seemed genuinely interested in our day and gave us help where ever needed. My husband and I have stayed in many hotels around the world at more than triple the price and have never experienced a more caring group of people. Enric and those who work with him all made a great difference in our Barcelona experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and super helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lenlip
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 10 nights. As pointed out by others, most outstanding features of this hotel are it's terrific location and extremely helpful staff. It's at the edge of L' Eixample, a short walk to the Plaza Catalunya, and Las Ramblas as well as several of Gaudi's highlight buildings. 3 metro stations are within a few minutes walk as well as good restaurants. The staff is extraordinarily helpful, especially the evening crew who helped us plan in detail a 3 day driving trip to the Costa Brava. The room is adequate size, bed was comfortable and bathroom clean and sufficiently spacious. We ate our breakfasts at nearby eateries, so didn't try the hotel restaurant. We highly recommend this hotel and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “cant praise it enough and would gladly return”
Reviews.Author: ldwmakeupdesign
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed for 5 nights at the lovely, immaculate Roger De Lluria in Barcelona. It is centrally located and in walking distance to public transportation and the office of Tourism. The staff couldn't be nicer and always willing to help with a smile. We would like to praise Christina, Mossimo, David and the manager for their patience,attentiveness and friendly attitude. The breakfast offered a variety of choices to suite all tastes.(juice, coffee, yogurt, cold cereal, eggs, cheeses, fruit and meat) The waitstaff was attentive and gracious,as well. My only suggestion is that on the weekend the front rooms can hear the people from the nightclub across the way...so you may want a room not facing the front.

Reviews.Title: “I'm wondering how this hotel has such a high rank”
Reviews.Author: Saqar
Reviews.Content: It is an ordinary 3 stars hotel with cons and props as follows: Props: staff is friendly and helpful Rooms are large and clean but tired except the bathroom modern with great Jacuzzi. Cons: bed is old too firm; you may need a rest somewhere else after a night sleep. The breakfast is very poor and the Wi-Fi doesn’t work properly. To reach the Ramblas you should walk around 10 mints or more depends on how crowded the roads.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the best hotel i've been to (and i've been to the Hilton Sri Lanka)”
Reviews.Author: BenAdoram1
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent - 10 minutes walk from Plaza Catalunya and La Rambla, but still in a quiet street; The room is spacious, elegantly decorated in a style which is ancient-classic but not over burdening; Equipped with a large LCD TV (don't waste time using it - go out to this beautiful city), a king size bed, and we had a large veranda with a small garden table and two sun beds; The amenities in the bath room included (in addition to the usual things) two tooth brushes, a shaving razor, and a comb; Everything and everywhere in the hotel was clean to the point of perfection, everything functions, not a screw out of place; Breakfast is rich, but in a pleasant and respectable way: unlike other hotels which staff the breakfast buffet with a huge variety just for variety's sake, and you know that what will not be eaten today will be thrown to the garbage or be served again tommorrow (can't decide which is worse), here there are great pastries and freshly cut fruits (as well as fish, jamon and cheeses, of course), but in a quantity that suits the number of guests. If something is finished, it is immediatley freshly refilled, but not overstaffed quantities, so food is not wasted; But this is just the appetizers: the real bonus of this hotel is the fantastic attitude of the staff: In the elegant dining room Jesus will anticipate your every need and wish even before you have time to express it; When you leave in the morning to your daily trip you will get a detailed explanation on how to get to your destination, with all the patience as if you're the only guest in the hotel (althought you're not); When you get back in the afternoon, Massimo will smile widely, shake your hand warmly and ask how was your day; and when we left, Christina actually came out from the reception, hugged us and bade us vaya con dios: truely a home away from home. If you're going to Barcelona, don't hesitate - go there! :)

Reviews.Title: “Best surprise in Europe”
Reviews.Author: Papoofnik
Reviews.Content: Without question, one of the better hotels in Europe for the money. I stayed 3 nights and everything went to my expectations - large room size, cleanliness was great, location was perfect, accessible but quiet, staff service was excellent. The breakfast was in line with other hotels and of good quality, but always room for improvement. I would highly recommend this hotel, and too bad they weren't located everywhere because i would want to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: we4luvluv2travel
Reviews.Content: Our family loved this hotel! We are picky travelers. Lobby area is small but very pretty. The rooms were well appointed, clean and spacious- esp for Europe. Beds were extremely comfortable. The area is quiet but close to everything. Placa de Catalyuna, Las Ramblas, trains, buses, shopping, great restaurants are all within easy walking distances. The breakfast was simple but tasty and had many options for all kinds of diets. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly, even after we checked out. My son left his Ipod and toiletry bag in the room. We emailed them and were able to make arrangements to pick it up after our return to Barcelona. My son was so happy that he was able to have his prize possession back. Not many hotels are that honest. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: DAJEngland
Reviews.Content: I had 5 rooms booked for a business trip and the hotel staff were efficent, friendly and extremely courteous. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: quincy50
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Good location, nice room with modern bath, good staff, adequate breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Really good room, great location, pleasant people”
Reviews.Author: oks943idk4
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights mid-week on a business trip. I had emailed the hotel beforehand to request a quiet room and the room I got was really good. I even had my own little terrace - not much of a view mind you, but it was still really nice. The bathroom was really big and clean, while the bedroom was also a great size and had a 42" flatscreen wall-mounted - nice! All staff that I encountered were very pleasant and helpful - particularly when I left my mobile phone in the room after I had checked out and left! This hotel is in a fantastic location and I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, fine staff, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: jde1776
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent six nights at the Roger De LLuria while making our first visit to Barcelona and celebrating our forty-fifth wedding anniversary. The hotel fully lived up to its reputation--rooms were bright and clean, the beds firm and very comfortable, the bathroom spotless, and, important for light sleepers like me, very little noise from outside. What I will remember most about the Roger De LLuria is the staff, which was cheerful, always helpful in responding to questions in English or patiently tolerating our faltering Spanish, and totally professional. When you encounter staff people like these, you always assume that the person at the top must be making some good management choices. Except for a few cab rides back to the hotel when we had walked long distances and were tired, we went everywhere on foot, to the nearby Ramblas, the Placa de Cataluyna, the Picasso Museum, Sagrada Familia Cathedral, the beaches and seafood restaurants, and many others. Nothing beats this location. My only suggestion would be to lower the price of breakfast in the hotel, perhaps by incorporating some of the cost in the room rate or just simplifying the menu--salmon and cheeses, fruits and pastries of every description are wonderful, and I confess that the breakfast was excellent--but I think most guests would prefer something less grand for a better price--say, 10 euros rather than 20 euros each. Forty euros for the both of us (around $57) is a bit excessive, especially since one can find excellent fare in the cafes up and down the street for just a few euros. But if you are like us, to get our day going, when we are still half asleep, we like to have breakfast in the hotel where we are staying, and there were a couple of days when there was rain in the morning, and going outside was inconvenient. At the very least, how about a coffee bar in the lobby with orange juice and croissants at a cheaper price? Despite this single criticism, our overall experience at the Roger De LLuria was delightful, and we will stay there on our next visit, which I hope is soon. Barcelona is unlike any city I have ever visited, and if you are lucky enough to be able to go, I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place! Great People!”
Reviews.Author: HelenAng
Reviews.Content: We were at Hotel Roger de Lluria for 5 days before & 1 day after our Mediterranean Cruise. Location was great, 8-10mins walk to Pl Catalunya. We had a Family Room for my family of four and a Double for my parents-in-law. The family room is situated at the back of the hotel and is quieter than the double room. Not much of a view, though, compared to the double room where it faces the main street. Both rooms were spacious and clean. What is outstanding about this small hotel was the people. Almost everyone was friendly and helpful. Prior to our trip, I had written several emails regarding a problem with booking for the last night, airport & pier transfers, etc and their response came swiftly. This good impression was further confirmed when we arrived at the hotel. We were greeted warmly and given a room immediately upon arrival. We were grateful for that as my in-laws (73 & 81 years old) were tired out after a long flight of 14 hrs. Cristina was probably one of the best receptionist I had ever come across in my years of travel. She is friendly, efficient, effective & most importantly, patient. She rightfully advised us that it was better to arrange for transfer from pier to hotel as we had a party of 6 + lots of luggage. We would have needed 2 taxis and there won't be much of a difference in terms of cost. Even tho I was undecided due to costs & timing, she was patient to let me sort out my thoughts and did not add any pressure on me to make a quick decision. She assured me that if the time arranged with her was not right, I could always call her or send her an email to change it. I was glad I took her advice to take the arranged transfer as the queue at the pier for taxis was really long and chaotic. I can't imagine going through the stress of trying to get transport to the hotel with my in-laws, 2 children, husband & many pieces of luggage. Didn't try the hotel's breakfast as I had read from the reviews that it's not worth it. There is the famous Bracafe nearby and they serve decent coffee & sandwiches. Two supermarkets are located one on the right & the other on the left, approx 5 mins walk. The one on the right is bigger & the fruits seemed fresher. Went there to stock up on water & snacks. One thing lacking in the hotel is that there was no boiler to make our own coffee/tea. I asked about it at the reception and was offered a flask of hot water instead. Toiletries were given but there were only a couple of pieces of tissue cramped in a tiny box. Had to go over to the supermarket to buy 2 boxes of tissues. On the whole, it's a great place to stay given its proximity to the Square, spacious room and warm & friendly personnel. Will choose this hotel again if I were to go back to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful rooms and terrific staff”
Reviews.Author: writer48
Reviews.Content: Barcelona turned out to be somewhat of a disappointment because of the massive onslaught of large cruise ships and the disgorging of thousands of passengers every day, but this hotel was a gem. A former Ritz hotel, this is a top-rate property within short walking distance of the Rambla, Plaza Catalunya, the Cathedral and the breathtaking Cathedral of the Sea (Santa Maria del Mar). While some Gaudi architecture is nearby, his major attractions require a cab or bus service. The rooms are large, clean and well-appointed. The front desk was mult-lingual and helpul. Massimo, one of the managers, was especially helpful, but we encountered no one who presented us with a less than positive experience. A small lounge bar is a delight at the end of the day. The area has dozens of fine eating places of all types within an eight-minute walk. A jazz lounge is directly accross the street and there is a fine Irish Pub (The George Payne) just a short stroll away. The staff will recommend plenty of choices and they are adept at finding just the right spot for your liking. We chose to walk (about twenty minutes) to an extraordinary tapas bar recommended by one manager that serves mostly the locals. It was worth the walk. Shopping areas are within short distances. There is a breakfast area in the hotel but we skipped that for the many nearby places. We would not recommend driving in Barcelona as there is great public transportation and parking is a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but.....”
Reviews.Author: katandbru
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the perfect location for visiting all the vacation spots one would want to see while in Barcelonia, (Gaudi Houses, Sagrada Familia Church, Music hall, Park Guell etc.). The rooms are spacious (most of them), clean and well appointed. The beds and pillow however are very very hard. When I asked for a softer pillow they were unable to accomodate. The first room we were given had one full size bed (for two people). If you would like a larger bed make sure to tell them you want a room with two twin beds and they will be puched together. I would give the hotel an overall good rating but for the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great find and great location”
Reviews.Author: johnjohnson1010
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through tripadvisor. It's almost right next door to the Palace, a few steps off of Gran Via Corts ed Catalonia, so it was near public transportation as well as being within walking distance of Cathedral, Ave. Garcia, etc. Barcelona is such a fabulous city, that I wish we had stayed here longer, and if and when we return, this hotel will be at the top of the list. My only recommendation (and it was only an issue falling asleep our first night) would be to ask for a room away from the street, but the 2nd and 3rd nights, I never noticed the noise and slept like a baby. Very helpful front desk personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: marmaar
Reviews.Content: When checking in we were upgraded from a standard double room to a family room with two enormous beds, minibar (but enough space for our own drinks), safe, 40inch flatscreen tv & an iron/trouser press. The room was very spacious as was the bathroom with a two person´s massage bath (+shower), toilet and bidet. The room was on the 4th floor looking out to courtyard and therefore very quiet. But if you listen very carefully you can just and just hear the metro once in a while passing through underground (and I think this goes for all Barcelona hotels as the metro network is large and covers most of the city) but not at all disturbing for your night sleep. We were able to sleep very well. The personnel were very friendly and the breakfast had something for everyone: coffee, tea, orange juice, fresh fruit, white and dark toast, breadrolls, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausages etc. All the main sights are in walking distance, La Rambla ca 8-10.min walk. Placa de Catalunya is only two blocks away and there you can catch one of the touristic buses or metro or other public transports. Taxis are also fairly inexpensive way to travel from one sight to another, ca 5-8 euro between the most sights. The taxi from the airport (T2) cost just a bit over 20 euros but please note that if you take the taxi TO the airport you need to pay 3,5 euro extra plus 1 euro per baggage. All-in-all a very nice 3 days in Barcelona and we would definitely stay again at Hotel Roger de Lluria.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the hotel before and after our cruise”
Reviews.Author: DrCrimson
Reviews.Content: My family (wife, son 9 and daughter 14) stayed here both before and after our cruise. We picked this hotel due to the good reviews, but also because it had family rooms that were good for the 4 of us. We were very pleased with hotel. It was a 15-20 minute walk to the Las Ramblas (you have to go eat in the market or Mercat....great place for lunch), the Basillica de Barcelona and the Plaza de Cataluyna. There were many restaurants, small cafes, bakeries, etc. to choose from in the area (they do eat late in Barcelona) and even a couple of chain restaurants that were open 24 hours (important with children that get hungry before 9 pm). There is also a small grocery store just around the corner from the hotel where you can pick up some great food for breakfast vs trying to get in a restaurant. Last, but certainly not least, the hotel was able to accommodate our earlier arrival both from the flight and the return from the cruise, which really helped us relax and get to some fun in Barcelona. The hotel was clean, the beds were nice, the room size was larger than most I have experienced in Europe, the staff was helpful and we had an overall outstanding stay in Barcelona. This is a great hotel choice for a family wanting to stay near the gothic district.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful, friendly, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: rachel3231
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights so the quality of staff and standard of service was important. From the Manager down they were delightful: friendly and very helpful, with excellent recommendations for restaurants and tapas bars, and conveying infectious enthusiasm for their lovely city and their Catalan culture. That makes a big difference! Hotel very comfortable. Its central location provides a convenient base for exploring the delights of Barcelona. It is in easy walking distance of most Gaudi sites, the old city, Opera Liceu, Ramblas, etc. Thoroughly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: unhappy065
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel to be greeted by friendly, helpful staff. Our rooms were upgraded for free. We had two rooms with massage baths that were brilliant. Our rooms had a TV in the bedroom and one in the bathroom. The beds were comfy and although you could hear the trafic it did not disturb us. Barcelona was lovely. We were unlucky with the weather but managed to see lots on the tour bus.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoEarl
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the deluxe room for 3 nights. We found the location to be excellent.The desk staff was very helpful and provided anything we asked for. My TV remote had low batteries and someone was in my room replacing them within 5 minutes of a phone call. We did not ever eat at the Hotel, but we liked our room and had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel--great location”
Reviews.Author: dredbuild
Reviews.Content: We were in a room on the 5th floor with our own terrace, a very nice room with a view. The staff were all very polite and helpful with directions and recommendations. The hotel is in a great location--we walked to many attractions all over the city. Many good restaurants and shopping within 10 minutes from the hotel. Close to Las Ramblas--went there once--too much of a tourist place for my taste. Two minor problems with the room--the bed was a little hard for my wife and me and occasionally during our showers we would get hot and cold flashes of water. Overall a great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at fair price”
Reviews.Author: dusansky
Reviews.Content: Our stay was April 16-19. Every positive comment from Tripadvisor was accurate. Much better than staying on a main drag, but only 8-10 minute walk to main drag, good restaurants, upscale shopping, downscale shopping and, very important, a major stop for the on-off tour bus. We bought a 2 day pass (discounted if buy at the hotel) and did all 3 routes (red, blue and green). Great sightseeing, especially if you sit on the top, open air level. Far superior to the private bus tour that we took upon leaving the cruise line. Our room was upgraded without asking. Very clean, spacious and completely quiet when we closed the patio doors and put on the AC. With patio doors open, just the usual city street noise.The hotel staff was uniformly friendly and very helpful. They take pride in their service. When we return to Barcelona, this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, would definitely recommend to others.”
Reviews.Author: GSP_Mom
Reviews.Content: My mom, sister and I stayed here for two nights in April during our two week tour of Europe, and we were very pleased with the hotel. The room (triple) was extremely spacious and clean, and the bathroom was even more so! The location is terrific - we walked everywhere for all sightseeing and didn't have to take a cab once. Cristina at the front desk was great in giving us the suggested sites to visit, and all of the staff was very friendly. Good breakfast buffet as well. I would certainly recommend this hotel to others. The one thing I'd note is that you can request a room with a private balcony when booking your reservation, but there are limited numbers of those so they cannot guarantee it. We had requested one, and unfortunately did not get it. Hopefully next time we will!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, highly recomended!”
Reviews.Author: hlaci
Reviews.Content: Location: 10 min. walk to Placa Catalunya / Las Ramblas, but the hotel is in a quiet street. Rooms: Very nice room with balcony, wide and comfortably beds, big bathroom with badthtub. Staff. very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great location, just perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: granger122
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel. The hotel is well located and only a 10 minute walk from the Ramblas. We stayed in a triple room which was very spacious and clean with plenty of space for our cases. There was plenty of choice for breakfast with hot and cold food. The staff were very helpful especially Massimo on the front desk who was very pleasant and welcoming with a smile every time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Center of Activities”
Reviews.Author: SpringsTraveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel Roger de Lluria - Our Ranking: Looks 4.5 Staff 4 and Price 4 .The price of 113 Euros per night seemed reasonable. Rooms were lovely and quiet, the location terrific -- close to both Place Catalunya, a metro stop, Passig de Gracia Blvd and theL'Eixample neighborhood. For two women, the bathroom was difficult to use. There was no counter space so no place to put make up or toiletries or even a tooth brush. The staff especially the evening crew were wonderfully helpful. Closet was small. Balcony was small but fun to have and look out to street and passerby.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel, Location and Staff all wonderful”
Reviews.Author: EarlyBird17
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic long "gastro" weekend in Barcelona staying at this hotel.The staff were very helpful and polite. We had a balcony room at the rear of the hotel, amazing!!! The hotel is in a nice location, short walk to the main square or the tube. Plenty of restaurants within a short distance, "Ca la Nuri" and "Patagonia" were great.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful! I stay here every time I go to Barcelona!”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler5230
Reviews.Content: I've traveled to Barcelona three times in the last 1/2 year and each time, I've stayed here. Why it's so great: 1) Wonderful rooms. I requested a room with a terrace - absolutely worth it! French doors open up to a large, beautiful terrace overlooking courtyard; small bistro table with two chairs, fresh flowers on the table - nice touch! Room was large, even by US standards. Clean, classy decoration, nice bath! 2) Great service. The desk staff cannot be nicer... So helpful with directions, restaurant recommendations, early check in if available. They are so very personable. 3) Breakfast. Nice if you get the breakfast included in the hotel rate - very good selection of hot and cold foods in a large beautiful salon! And, great coffee! 4) Location, location, location! 10 min walk to Ramblas. Also, hotel is just a few mins to Gaudi house (a must see!) and in that area are many, many great restaurants. I'd recommend Citrus - on 2nd floor, overlooking main street, very nice, classy, great food selection, and reasonably priced too! There's also a gym just 50 meters away from hotel (DIR) where guests of hotel can use facilities free of charge! GREAT GYM! Without doubt, I'll stay here every time I travel to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel "find" in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: danaustin
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from a 3 day stay in beautiful Barcelona. Our experience at the hotel Roger de Lluria was excellent. First it is hard to imagine a more central location. Our room was exactly as presented in the website materials: a VERY large main bed (I think it was 2 queens connected) and a small cot for our 17 year old son in a corner. The room itself was fine but a bit dated. The bathroom was large. Internet service was slow. The continental breakfasts each morning were terrific. But the best part of the hotel was the front desk service. We relied on Christina and Massimo for everying from restaurant ideas and bookings, booking of a guitar concert, to suggestions on how to get from place to place. Christina was exceedingly friendly and superb and always willing to help (same with Massimo). I would stay agin.

Reviews.Title: “really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Skamom
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Hotel Roger de LLuria with a triple room. The room had 2 large beds-maybe queen size and then a single in a separate space. The room size is very good--very large bathroom with nice amenities and towels. Because it is still spring, they did not have the air on, so we had to keep the window open at night. I never heard any noise even with the window open. I can't say I liked the extra large pillows and there was no coffee/tea maker--that's my worst criticism, which isn't much. Nice flat screen tv-only 2 channels in English, but that was ok. Free wi-fi in the hotel. I booked with breakfast included-so that was nice. The best things about the hotel-which is why I booked this one after reading MANY other reviews-is the location and the staff. It is short walk-maybe 8 to 10 minutes from Plaza Cataluna with our bags-to the aerobus stop. (5.30 Euros each one way) Lots of places to shop and eat and we walked to Las Ramblas and the harbor-no problem. The staff is so nice and helpful-as many other TA readers have said. We found out that if we would have bought our tourist bus tickets from them, we would have saved a few euros each..oh well! But we got 2 great eating recommendations from Massimo. He was so nice and helpful. He even made the reservations for us one night and we just walked over to the restaurant. Very very happy we stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Kmjp
Reviews.Content: The staff was helpful and friendly. Very willing to help with anything we needed. The location was good - easy to get where we wanted to go. Breakfast was a nice touch. Rooms large, comfortable, clean, and stylish. Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: scoobyju1
Reviews.Content: Once again, Trip Advisor did not disappoint! Based on this site, we booked this hotel. On arrival we were upgraded from a standard double room to a deluxe room. The room had 2 comfortable beds, a fridge (minibar technically but enough to store some of your own drinks) safe, 40inch flatscreen tv & an iron/trouser press. The room was very spacious with a balcony & french windows. The bathroom was also spacious & had an amazing shower & a massage bath!! The service was very good. We always got a smile & were acknowledged when we passed through reception. We had one minor problem. It was the air conditioning.
