We were shown how to use it only to find out it would only heat & not cool. We spoke to the person on the desk who informed us that as the air con unit/building is very old, it will only heat. This was disappointing as even though its early spring, it still got very warm at night. We had to open the windows to cool down but considering we were in Barcelona, the street noise wasn't really an issue. That said, it was the only problem. The hotel & it's staff are wonderful. The location is good, just far enough away from the hustle & bustle but close enough to be near the important stuff. Oh & free wifi! We didn't have breaktfast but will recommend cafe Europa, approx 2 blocks up on the right hand side.

Reviews.Title: “Everything has already been said!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shifenated
Reviews.Content: Myself and a woman friend stayed at the above for 4 nights last week and we had a memorable time. The hotel is perfectly positioned to access most of the tourist spots, yet it is away from the main thoroughfare. Street is very busy, but entering the hotel is lie entering an oasis. Not a sound to be heard. We asked for a twin room and got a double bed each. The comfort of the beds was such I didn't want to get out of it. Unfortunately we brought horrendous type rain with us for the 1st 3 days, but it was a pleasure coming back to the hotel to sit in the comfy armchairs or lie on our sumptious beds in our room. All the staff, Roger, Claudio, Massimo, Hakim and the lovely barman whose name I could not pronounce so I christened him Linguine, they were all so pleasant and for me to remember anyone's name is a miracle. They went out of their way to be helpful and all had fluent English. The Manager made himself known to us the 1st morning, we had coffee with him, and he gave us some wonderful, recommendations for restaurants. I'm keeping the names a secret if we every go back!!!. Breakfast was amazing, the selection was incredible and 1 could quite happily gorge themselves if they wished. The only quibble i would have was in the dining room for beverages, they used thermal jugs, which although felt hot to touch were in fact almost cold when poured. And like most Irish I have to have my hot cup of tea in the morning. As I said this was a minor quibble, but I think they should do something about it. Other than that a wonderful time was had by us despite the appalling weather. I would definitely stay there again, despite this being my 4th time in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend - great hotel, great location, great service!!”
Reviews.Author: bszcr
Reviews.Content: Would def recommend this hotel. Location was excellent, just a couple of streets from the main square - placa catalonya - and the top of la ramblas. The service was also excellent, from the greeting when we arrived and the extra bed provided on first night to all the advice given on how to get around Barcelona and where to eat etc. Massimo on reception and the porter who was on when we arrived - sorry dont remember his name - were particularly friendly and helpful, they definitely eased our stay in Barcelona. The city itself is also fabulous, the bus tours are great to get an idea of the city and the the 'old' town around the cathedral, just off la ramblas, is really not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Really friendly, helpful staff...............”
Reviews.Author: tobybigdog
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel with friendly staff in a good location near to the Rambla and plaza de Catalunya where the bus stops from the airport. Rooms were clean and comfortable and the breakfast relaxed and reasonably tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barcelona01
Reviews.Content: Went there with my wife and my 5 years old daughter. This hotel is clean, confortable and in a good location. Staffs are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Hawkeye-490
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 7 minutes walk from the "town center", Placa de Catalunya. The airport bus drops you off at this square, tours leave from here, etc. There is also a subway stop about 4 minutes from the hotel. So, the location is great. We were warmly received, the room was as described, and we were quite satisfied during our 3 nights at Roger de Lluria. The breakfast was phenomenal, as for us, included in the nightly room rate. Otherwise, breakfast is a whopping 20 Euro/person. I love staying at hotels where is staff is friendly and attentive. It makes all the difference. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel – helpful staff, good location, comfy room.”
Reviews.Author: 60922Traveler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a very good location – walking distance to all major attractions, but far enough from noise of La Ramblas. Our room was large, clean and comfortable and stuffed with all the necessities. Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful and spoke good English, including technician who came to help with the safe. Front desk clerks went out of their way to be helpful, always had good recommendations, helped with reservations, etc. Cristina at the front desk is the nicest service representative we’ve met during our 10-day trip to Europe. We would definitely return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Can't imagine a better place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SD_MandJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in January. We chose this hotel based on the reviews on TA and it did not disappoint! Our room, which was the basic two twin, was a very decent size. The bathroom was big and contained all the amenities you could think of. I actually caught a cold during the trip and had to stay in the room for a full day. Thank goodness they had a nice flat screen with at least 5 english channels and free WiFi. The beds were so comfortable and soft compared to most European beds. We are so anti-smoking so it was so nice to come back to a room with no hint of cigarette smoke. The room was a little bit dated, but everything else was perfect. The location was great because it was in very safe neighborhood, an ATM two doors down, and a grocery store a block away. The metro was about a 5 minute walk, and the Ramblas is about 10 minutes away. The best thing I loved about this hotel was the staff! They were so friendly and so helpful. The front desk spoke English very well and the entire staff just blew us away with their hospitality. If I ever go back to Barcelona, definitely staying at the Roger de Lluria!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in good location, The staff are very friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: russ_kelly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for my wifes 40 th birthday with my 2 children, We were upgraded to a deluxe room when we checked in which was a nice suprise and a bottle of chamapagne was left in our room for my wife. The hotel is in a great location close to the main city attractions but not to near the hussle and bussle, two minor things we picked up on, The breakfast is very expensive if you choose to have it, 20 euro's each per adult per day, and 10 euro's per child per day, There are plenty of cafe's around the hotel where you can get breakfast much cheaper, the second minor point was that the people next door had there t v on very loud a few times as the walls are quite thin but as soon as we mentioned this to the reception they dealt with it straight away. We would stay here again the next time we visit Barcelona, 2 quick tips to see all the sites go on the the red and blue tourist bus routes well worth the money, Discount tickets available from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Enric the manager made my birthday”
Reviews.Author: joycewinifred
Reviews.Content: I chose the Hotel Roger De Lluria for my self and friends to stay in Barcelona to celebrate my 60th birthday. Enric, the manager, advised/ recommended restaurants to tour guides all of which proved amazingly successful. He really knows his business. All my guests were delighted with their rooms they were clean, spacious, many with very large comfy beds, (the smaller beds were comfy too),. The breakfast buffet was delicious with a wide choice, do try the Almond cake! We even booked in for Sunday lunch, a mouth watering Paella. The staff could not be more helpful and friendly nothing was too much trouble, they were like friends helping you to have a wonderful time. They even all signed a birthday card and brought it with a truly amazing birthday cake during breakfast (we had it for tea later in the afternoon). The hotel was centrally located perfect for exploring and popping into the old City. We will certainly return. I can't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again - Great Location and Staff”
Reviews.Author: RTWmom
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel from TA reviews. It was perfect for us. Short taxi ride from the train staion. We walked everywhere else - from Sagrada Familia to the waterfront. We never took the subway because everywhere was close enough to walk. We did take the tourist bus one day on both routes. It was fantastic. Again the bus stop was within easy walking distance from hotel. The room was a triple with two double beds pushed together and a third single bed in a small alcove by the window, giving our daughter a little privacy. Bathroom was huge and modern with hairdryer, shower and tub. The beds were very comfortable with extra pillows and blankets. Individual thermostat for room. Free wifi and one computer in lobby for use by guests at small charge. The mini bar has plenty of room to store your own sodas from the local store down the street. The two elevators were fast and not crowded. Breakfast was a wide selection of breads, desserts, eggs, bacon, fruit, yogurt, cereal and juices (fresh squeezed). Only thing missing was a waffle or pancake for my daughter. The staff was fabulous. They were warm and welcoming. They speak English very well. They made several good restaurant recommendations and helped us with walking directions and maps. There is a Europcar rental location just around the corner on Gran Via for easy access if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: sleugers
Reviews.Content: Best things about the Hotel Roger de Lluria: Location near many attractions and the Plaza Catalunya metro station, helpful staff. The brunch buffet looked rather nice, but at 20 Euro a head, it made more sense for us to grab a quick and delicious, if uninspired, breakfast around the corner at Pans. Fresh squeezed OJ, cafe con leche, and 2 breakfast sandwiches for 3 Eruo. Done. Our room was on the small side--they said because we had a room with a terrace, but it was clean and adequate. Bathroom layout a bit awkward with the bidet, but the shower was nice. The bed rolled around quite easily, which was a little strange, but the mattress and linens were fine. Not a heavenly bed by any stretch, but not treacherous either.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Holly1875
Reviews.Content: We booked seven nights in early Jan. 2011 at Hotel Roger De Lluria. We were a little wary in that we could find no mention of this hotel on any other travel sites or guide books that we read but went ahead anyway based on the TA reviews and the hotel's rating on TA. We were not disappointed! The front desk staff, especially Christina and Massimo, were excellent. All were friendly and helpful. After our first night in a room at the front we asked to be moved to the back because of the street noise (we are light sleepers). We were given a choice of 2 rooms, one of which was an upgrade. We were able to move immediately into the new, much quieter and bigger room and incurred no extra charges. There were only two "issues" with the hotel. First, the maid service wasn't as good as it could be but it wasn't terrible (sometimes the sink was cleaned and sometimes it wasn't - that kind of thing). When we told Christina she went into problem-solving mode, immediately called the housekeeping manager and the service improved. Secondly, the buffet breakfast was an additional 20 Euros per person. We don't eat that much and didn't want to spend that much so were directed to a nearby "BraCafe". It was ok but we would have preferred to eat at the hotel. We did figure out our last couple of mornings that we could order coffee and cereal ala carte in the bar opposite the lobby area. That worked very well for us. I don't think they like to encourage that but when you stay here know that it's an option. Overall we were very pleased and thank the TA reviewers for "directing" us to this great hotel.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington DC, District of Columbia, USA
Reviews.Title: “First visit to Barcelona and we loved this hotel--would definitely stay again”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlDC7
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a trip to Barcelona and London with a friend and we were so happy with our stay here. Since we were sharing a room we were pleasantly surprised at the good size of the room and the bathroom. We were very impressed with the soundproofing of the rooms as well. We faced the main street and with the window closed you could not hear the street traffic at all. This was true within the room as well--the bathroom was completely quiet and private which is nice when you are sharing. Additionally the rooms were very clean and the bathroom had a really nice spa tub with jets. The staff was fantastic, especially the concierge, Mossimmo. He helped us every day with dinner reservations and touring plans. This was especially appreciated when we waiting until very late on New Year's Eve to make dinner reservations. The location is not in the heart of the touristy Los Ramblas area but it is only a few short blocks and we enjoyed the quieter location. There is a pharmacy across the street, a bank machine a few doors down and a grocery store just around a corner. There is also a spa right next door and a local bar/cafe just 2 doors down that is a local 'joint' with really good prices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms with exceptional broader guidance from front desk”
Reviews.Author: RogereCanberra
Reviews.Content: This smallish hotel offers more personalised guidance than bigger, more expensive hotels nearby. It has excellent and luxurious rooms in a good location near the city sites. Very much appreciated the willingness of front desk staff to chat and advise us on what to do and with excellent suggestions on where to go. A number of the reception area staff and management had visited our home country and had excellent English language skills and understanding of our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a Barcelona visit”
Reviews.Author: PickyKate007
Reviews.Content: This is a charming boutique hotel with a European flair. We asked for a room in the back and had no outside noise and three very quiet nights of quality sleep. The staff is wonderful. Between the person at the front desk and the concierge they made reservations at a lovely local restaurant & booked us tickets to a charming Spanish guitar recital and a dinner flamingo show. They never seemed hurried and always treated us as if we were the only guests they had. The rooms are good sized with lovely marble appointed bathrooms and loads of complimentary products. The room comes with fluffy robes and slippers. The small refrigerator is fully stocked yet with room to add your own purchases. The location is terrific – on a smaller street just off the Ramblas. We walked to most places. The metro , the 24 bus to the Guell Park and the airport bus (A1 or A2 depending on your terminal) are about 15 minutes of leisurely walking away. Barcelona has terrific public transportation! We looked at many reviews on TA before choosing this hotel and were rewarded with a no hassle, quiet, and comfortable stay. The rooms have free wifi, plenty of pillows/blankets, a thermostat that works, and good soundproofing. It was a great value at $100 euros/night.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ichabod777
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here very much. It exceeded on several points; cleanliness, location, rooms, and service. The staff was wonderful. The manager helped me pick out some great restaurants in the city and navigate the bus system. The bartender from Uruguay was fun. I strongly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel. Reception staff extremely helpful.”
Reviews.Author: teresapolhill
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very large and extremely comfortable beds. 2 Queen-sized beds, plus a single! Bathrooms were excellent too. The reception staff were so willing to help and give advice on day-trips and local restaurants. We spoke no Spanish and found they were always friendly and helpful. The hotel was very quiet and the location was very central as you could easily walk to most tourist places and even in the evenings we felt very safe walking back to the hotel. Thank you to all who made our first trip to Barcelona a great holiday! Teresa and Lionel. New Zealand

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: viv1viv2
Reviews.Content: Elegant, comfortable and very well situated. Beautiful breakfasts. Lovely, friendly and helpful staff and reception.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel experience of my life!”
Reviews.Author: sushaskell
Reviews.Content: My friend had booked 2 double rooms ( one for each) for 4 days at the start of our trip and 2 days at the end. As we were checking in on the first day, her bag was stolen from the lobby. The hotel said they were not responsible for the loss, since the bag wasn't stolen from our room. (We spent our first day going to 2 police stations to fill out forms, and then my friend had to replace all of her clothes, shoes, suitcase, etc.) We thought the staff would at least be honest and pleasant to us, and sorry for the loss, but they were not. They lied about a tour we had signed up for, annoyed that we hadn't booked it through them, and said the tickets hadn't arrived, when the agency said they had faxed them to the hotel. They also said the agency didn't open til 10:00 (the tour was for 8:00), but we called and found that they were open earlier). They wouldn't help with adaptors and converters to recharge my camera, said I should go to a department store to buy whatever I needed. But the worst of all was that they gave away our prepaid rooms for the last 2 nights. After driving around for a week in between, we ended up back in Barcelona with no rooms! Since we had already paid, they offered to find us rooms at another hotel, and we spent 2 hours waiting in the lobby while they called around (looking for rooms that were less expensive than what we had already paid). They lied about a suite that supposedly had 2 bedrooms, but in fact, when we went to see it, not believing anything they said, we found it was one bedroom with one bed, and then finally they found 2 rooms of lower quality than what we had paid for. All in all, this was the worst hotel experience of my life, and I would certainly want to warn anyone considering it!!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: keysday
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful. The location was perfect, we walked everywhere and it was local to all the sites! The room was perfect too, we were upgraded to the Junior Suite and I felt like a queen. The staff made it even more perfect. They were friendly and helpful, solving little problems quickly. Listen to Francesco and Christina's suggestions, they know the city and will help make a great trip. Enrique (the Manager) is the greatest. They made great selections and gave great directions. We fell in love with Barcelona, and they gave us a home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, great location, beautiful quiet room, excellent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: vancouver064
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at Hotel Roger. We took blue Aerobus from Barcelona Airport to Plaza Catalunya for 5 euros each. We then waked to the hotel - approx 500 meters. There were taxis at the plaza for those who dont want the walk. The hotel is away from the crowds around Las Ramblas - but still within walking distance to everything. The staff are excellent - especially Christina and Franseco. We had a very quiet room - with A/C that worked. The rooms are lovely, and the bath towels are thick and luxurious. We took the buffet breakfast every morning and it was excellent.. This hotel was exactly what we expected. Highly recommend this hotel. Thanks Hotel Roger for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: olflx2
Reviews.Content: 2 blocks from Passeig de Gracia; 10-15 minute stroll to La Rambla or Cathedral. Nice neighborhood. Staff knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. Large, well-decorated room in front. All exactly as shown on their website. Spotless. Would happily book again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Find in the Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Snowwillow
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at this hotel and were very pleasantly surprised. Cristina at the front desk was terrific at helping us make the reservations from the States, giving us information once we arrived, and most of all, being friendly and welcoming - a real plus. Everyone there was very pleasant, but she was the shining star in our book. The location is great - close to Las Ramblas, shopping, transportation, Barri Gotic and the Picasso Museum, Palau de la Musica (we much enjoyed the Flaminco performance we attended there one night!), Plaza Catalyna, restaurants, car rental, etc. It was a short walk to some very good breakfast places. Although they are on a busy side street, the noise is barely audible when the doors/windows and curtains are closed - they did a good job. Although the hotel itself is a bit older, it is beautiful and we were very happy overall.

Reviews.Title: “A beutiful Hotel & amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: GalMaya
Reviews.Content: first, the hotel is located in a quiet and a very central point near plaza catlunya. The rooms are big and very clean. The extra value of this hotel is the staff. Massimo, Christina, Francesco - They are unblieveble. so assistance, kind and helpful. They made this trip so wonderful. way to go !!! Gal and Maya

Reviews.Title: “Good location, quiet, huge bed!!”
Reviews.Author: BDL999
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights before a cruise. It was festival weekend and Barcelona was hopping. The hotel is off the main streets so it was nice and quiet, but a quick walk to great shopping, restaurants and the #1 stop for the hop on/hop off bus. The room was plenty large for three of us with a small alcove by the window for the third bed which worked well. The bed for my husband and I was a double double. It was huge and our daughter called it "the bed of wonder". The bathroom was nice and spacious with everything we needed. Breakfast in the hotel was good with lots of selection and the staff were very helpful throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “hotel was nice, what it lacked in was made up with the”
Reviews.Author: fishhead123
Reviews.Content: had a fantastic stay at your hotel .what made made my stay complete was the care and attention thet was provided to myself and my colleges by your staff. mostmention ably Francesco he went above and beond to help us with our every need

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hote, great staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: dcpatti
Reviews.Content: I wish we'd been able to stay for more than one night but commitments elsewhere in Barcelona took us away; if we'd been able to change our plans, I'd have cancelled our other hotel in a heartbeat! we had a junior suite on the 1st floor (one up from Ground level which is how they do it here in Europe): massive by European standards and still extremely large by US hotel standards. We really enjoyed soaking in the jacuzzi tub. Entire room spotless. Very large sitting room, separate from bedroom, would be nice for entertaining or socializing. Whole suite had unexpectedly high ceilings and lovely tin ceiling in sitting room. The only negatives: sofa in sitting room not particularly comfortable; wi-fi is extremely slow, to the point that it really didn't work unless you got lucky. If you are trying to do actual work during your stay, make other arrangements for Internet access. There is some hallway noise that drifts through the walls but about what I'd expect in an older building. Staff was remarkable. Extremely helpful. I felt that they really, truly wanted to be helpful and accomodating. They speak about a dozen languages each. No matter where you are from, there will be someone here to help you in your native language (which makes it harder for me to practice my Spanish!). Very accomodating of our request for early check-in as our flight from the States landed at 8am and we needed a shower and nap. I did find it just a wee bit expensive even by European standards but I think that's more a reflection on how expensive some things in Barcelona are, and nothing unique to the hotel. Breakfast: having seen several negative comments about the breakfast, I would like to say that this is not a Holiday Inn in America. You will not get pancakes and hash browns as part of their morning buffet. There is, however, a very nice spread of high-quality Spanish hams and salames, nice cheeses, pastries and a small tray of eggs. I found the breakfast to be quite lovely both in terms of variety and of quality. Location: outstanding. On a more quiet block that's within a 5-minute walk to the Placa Cataluna; subway stop right out front; easy access to taxi's; many choices for dining within a block or two; the neighborhood does close down on Sundays so you may have to walk a little further but we managed to find several good choices for dinner within about 4 blocks on a Sunday night. Bed seems a little stiff/hard/overly firm when first settling in but somehow in just a few minutes it becomes quite comfortable. We slept very well!

Reviews.Title: “Customer service and location were terrific”
Reviews.Author: Calif95628
Reviews.Content: Cristina and Massimo, two of the hotel's staff, made our stay in Barcelona one of the highlights of our trip to Spain. Despite our constant needs of assistance they were always responsive, courteous and helpful. Sights from the Barri Gotic to the Sagrada Familia are within easy walking distance of the hotel. We also found good tapas bars and restaurants nearby

Reviews.Title: “Vacation on the coast”
Reviews.Author: Ojaghian
Reviews.Content: this is a great hotel the staff was very helpful and friendly. one of their staff by the name of Fransisco was the most helpful member I have met in 35 years of traveling. I needed to ship a item to the US and he assisted by calling 3 different companies to get me the best price and made all the arrangements for shipping. Fransisco made our stay very enjoyable and fun. the rest of the staff were very friendly and offered to help with directions recommendations and luggage.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful "boutique hotel" in barcelona”
Reviews.Author: jorgecapirone
Reviews.Content: 2 wees ago I stayed at Hotel Roger de Lluria in Barcelona. It was a pleasant surprise its friendly staff as well as the impeccable service everywhere. Rooms are spacious, breakfast is very good and location couldn't be better. Really "the" hotel to stay in the eixample area, not far from the old part of the town neither in the center of the noisy area ,,, thank you for the nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Pre & Post-Cruise Perfection”
Reviews.Author: momziekins
Reviews.Content: Thanks to reviews on Trip Advisor, I chose this hotel, just off La Ramblas in Barca. It was so perfect! Near to everything a tourist could need, but not in a dicey area, so I always felt safe. It was a 10 to 15 Euro taxi fare to the cruise ship. Aerobus to airport was close & easy. Liked the free Wi Fi. Price was right for room but didn't buy their fancy, expensive breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: travel_nut24
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 adults and we stayed in one of the "family rooms" at this hotel. The room was very large with 2 queen beds, flat screen tv, seperate area for storage and a huge bathroom with large jacuzzi/tub/shower. There was tons of space for all of us and our luggage! The hotel was very clean and well decorated. A small, but nice lobby area and a very large breakfast room. we stayed here for 4 nights and found the staff to be extremely friendly and the hotel manager, Enric, was fabulous. He made a point of introducing himself and provided a wealth of information regarding where to eat, shop and what to see. The hotel is well located just a few blocks from Plaza Catalunya and la Rambla, but far enough away to avoid the craziness and noise! We felt the area around the hotel to be very safe and convenient to everything. We were fortunate to have breakfast included in our stay and it was excellent! Great variety of items - juice, yoghurt, fruit, pastries, eggs, bacon and more. We thought the hotel was a good value and would definitely stay here again. The only negative points about our stay was that the jacuzzi in our bathroom had a shower feature which proved to be a bit of a challenge. As there wasn't a shower curtain, the water pretty much went everywhere when having a shower, fortunatey the bathroom walls were fully tiled!! Second, we had a cockroach in our room the morning we left - I would reccomend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Barcelona.”
Reviews.Author: delene7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little jewel. Perfect location, between Paseo de Gracia and Plaza de Catalunya. Had an alcove for our teenage daughter; rooms that accommodate 3 comfortably are a rarity in Europe. The front desk staff could not have been more helpful. Obnoxious, loud family in the room next door not their fault. Exceptional value; will be our go-to hotel in Barcelona. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mosky4813
Reviews.Content: As soon as we arrived in a cab a hotel employee came outside to greet us and take our bags. Then he escorted us to the front desk where we were met and immediately checked in. The gentlemen working at the front desk gave us a map upon which he highlighted the major attractions, plazas and metros to use. We wound up using his map and suggestions for the entire trip and it was great. The hotel is situated in a perfect location. It is right off of Placa de Cataluna and very close to Las Ramblas. Everything is within walking distance but if you want to take a cab there are plenty right outside or there are two metro stations on two different lines to get anywhere. We got to our room to find it was a great size with very comfortable beds. The bathroom was amazing!! The shower was fantastic and the hotel supplied several bottles of shampoo, toothpaste, toothbrush, etc. Room service cleaned every day and refreshed the towels. It was great to come back for siesta in the afternoon since the beds were so comfortable. Every time we exited and returned the person manning the front desk would greet us and ask us how our day was. They were also aware of the tours we wanted to take and would remind us of what time they left and how long it would take from the hotel to arrive at the departing point. Basically, this is a fantastic hotel to stay at with great rooms, excellent service and a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel with superior service.”
Reviews.Author: grammy2dmax
Reviews.Content: I found this on Trip Advisor. Thanks to all of you who wrote reviews. The hotel is lovely, clean, comfortable and in a good location. Roger and Mossimo were charming and so helpful! I would difinately stay here again ( and I'm very fussy!)

Reviews.Title: “European boutique hotel with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: john25expat
Reviews.Content: It is a very charming hotel just 2 blocks to Plaza Catalonia and Ramblas. We booked a Classic room with kingsize overlooking main street and we had a lovely stay, Staff is really professional, specially: Guilermo,Cristine and Lungany. It was our 10th wedding aniversary and they offered us a complimentary botlle of local champagne.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful European Hotel with charm, class and wonderful employees!”
Reviews.Author: mbernwanger
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Roger de Lluria was in a wonderful location. The rooms are well appointed, spacious with a beautiful bathrooms. Air conditioning worked very well as it was a very warm August for all of Europe! The breakfast (included in the cost of the room) was a wonderful way to start your day. We would seriously consider just staying there for a week. We were thrilled with the service and the employees. They made us feel very special. I would strongly recommend the hotel to anyone! Thank you for making the first few days of our vacation, even more special!

Reviews.Title: “Quite Pleasant Hotel With Very Good Service”
Reviews.Author: LindaE_10
Reviews.Content: We travelled with our son (age 12). Check in was very smooth and the staff was very helpful. The room was surprisingly spacious by European standards and well-sized even by U.S. standards. The room had all modern amenities as well as a very nice balcony. The hotel is situated on a quiet street street - just a few blocks from Plaza Catalunya. Therefore, you have mutiple dining and sightseeing options within easy walking distance. Try Ciudad Condal for tapas - recommended by staff and very good. Excellent value!

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: danderm
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Barcelona for three days prior to going on a Disney cruise with our children, ages 7 and 10. We were prepared for a typical small European hotel room, but were pleasently surprised to find a room larger than what we would have expected in the US. Christine at the front desk was very pleasent, as was the entire staff and the location was excellent. We would definatly recommend this hotel to anyone, especially families.

Reviews.Title: “Calm and convenient base, with exemplary service”
Reviews.Author: rhonalou
Reviews.Content: I am fortunate enough to be staying at this hotel, having read the good reviews on Trip Advisor. The room and facilities are on a par with what you may expect for a hotel and 4 times the price of this one, and every single member of staff I have encountered has been charming, helpful, friendly and seemingly fluent in English - down to the extremely polite and friendly chambermaid. Safe, quiet area, within ready walking distance from the city's main attractions, and a 5 minute walk to the metro. I didn't have the nerve to ask for a room with a balcony, which I am sure would add to the experience even more. Breakfast really lovely, very wide choice with excellent service. Free internet. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: dukefh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Barcelona for several days before boarding a cruise. We arrived in the morning from the U.S. in need of a long nap before a scheduled tour that afternoon. When we checked in the staff was very accommodating and we were able to go to a room within 15 minutes of our arrival. The room was very spacious, lovely decorated and extremely comfortable.The hotel is a boutique hotel with an extremely friendly and knowledgeable staff who were able to recommend and book all arrangements. The location of the hotel is great and is within only a few minutes walk of many attractions and only a couple of blocks from the excellent Metro system. The hotel serves an excellent full breakfast which was included in the rate. We actually stayed at another hotel on our return from the cruise but if we had known we would have stayed again at the Roger de Lluria.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: 4travelers2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel through a recommendation from our travel agent. We were spending a few days in Barcelona prior to our cruise. We wanted a room which would accomodate all 4 of us (me, my husband, 18 year old son and 23 year old daughter). We were booked into a "family suite". Upon our 9:30am arrival to the hotel, we were immediately given the keys to our room. I had the travel agent call the morning of our departure and request our room be ready upon our arrival. After an 8 hour flight, we were ready to sleep! The accomodations were wonderful, the room was spacious, beautiful bathroom, and the front desk was extremely helpful. Made restaurant recommendations and reservations, and even gave us the name of a gym for my kids to do their daily workout. I would most definitely stay at this hotel again, and I recommend it highly! Great location as well. Central to all that we wanted to do.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, top to bottom”
Reviews.Author: asahmed7
Reviews.Content: A superb experience, and almost unbelievable for the price. They upgraded us to a deluxe room upon arrival for no charge. Beautiful, elegant lobby; high-speed lifts; tasteful decorations. Large room with balcony. Bathroom freshly renovated and state of the art. Plush room furnishings. Location, in the fashionable Eixample (and a stone's throw from Plaza de Catalunya and the Ramblas), is outstanding. Looking forward to our next stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely AMAZING hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jenny921
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at the Hotel Roger De Lluria in Barcelona and was EXTREMELY happy with my stay! The hotel was very clean, breakfast was great (eggs, bread, pastries, coffee, tea, fruit, cheese, bacon, quiches, etc.), the rooms were spacious, safes were in the room, access to FREE Wi-Fi anywhere in the hotel....everything was GREAT! The staff was SUPERB! The staff was extremely helpful in suggesting restaurants, sites to see, tours to take...anything you want to do they can help you! I would recommend this hotel to families, couples, ANYONE!

Reviews.Title: “Warm, welcoming, comfortable hotel in perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: sandyp37
Reviews.Content: I certainly stayed at the Hotel de Lluria in Barcelona and couldn't been happier with both the accommodations as well as the service. My sister and I were celebrating my mom's 90th birthday and the staff were charming and wonderful to her. In addition to recommending a hotel, they called ahead to tell them it was my mom's birthday so she was toasted with champagne. My mom was given a large single room and she felt like a queen. My sister and I shared a very comfortable double room. I can't recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly, helpful and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: beirawoman
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long week-end in Barcelona with friends and the hotel exceeded expectations. Location is excellent, being in the centre of Barcelona and consequently within walking distance of many attractions and restaurants. The staff were friendly, helpful and the rooms were well equipped and extremely clean. The only downside was a lack of water pressure in the morning when everyone turned on their showers but this was a small price to play for the pleasure of staying in this hotel. Thanks to all front of house staff.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem”
Reviews.Author: gonefishingPerth
Reviews.Content: So glad we choose to stay at Hotel Roger De Lluria at the end of our trip - it was almost home away from home. Love the balcony! Wish we had more time to enjoy the hotel. The staff was friendly especially Mossimo, who was very friendly and welcoming. Nothing worst than a serious, business-like & unwelcoming Reception staff, which we did encountered in Seville and Granada who seem impatient with yet another 'frequently asked question' from tourists :-). It may be a bit further away from Placa Catalunya or the La Rambla but there are other nice shops, cafes and restaurants nearby. If one wants a change from Tapas try the Japanese restaurant about 5-10 walk to the right of hotel on Roger de Lluria- fantastic buffet lunch for Eur8.50 - eat all you can and you can even select fresh meats or seafood and the chef will BBQ them for you. Will love to stay here again next time we are in BCN!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JFake
Reviews.Content: My Mother, sister and myself stayed 1 night after our cruise. After reading many reviews I chose this hotel because of the location and reviews of the staff friendliness. Needless to say, the reviews were right on!! The hotel is clean, just far enough away from the hustle and bustle but close enough to walk to La Ramblas, and my Mother is 75 and had no trouble with the walk. We had a great experience here and would highly recomend to anyone looking for a place in Barcelona!!! The staff even called the taxi driver we had from the previous day for us. Everything was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel we have been to in a long time!!”
Reviews.Author: Kristin22
Reviews.Content: It's very rare that the hotel itself plays a mayor role in a visit, but this hotel did!!! What a friendly staff, want to mention Massimo in particular! He is just the best. He just got that x-factor:) So all we need to say is that we felt very welcome and can recomand this hotel to everybody that needs a nice hotel with a perfect location and the best staff ever!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Maximos and staff for making our stay there very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: floridacruisers
Reviews.Content: We were a group of friends, we stayed at the hotel for 3 days before our cruise. We picked this hotel after reading all the reviews on this site and we have to say we were not disappointed. Everything about it was good! rooms were clean and the breakfast was very versatile not just a continental breakfast. We all have to say that the front desk employees made it for us. They guided us to good reaturants and directed us to great tours... Maximos was the best... Thank you again for making our stay a memorable one! Cruise was also excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “Another rave review!!”
Reviews.Author: Stephka
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in convenient yet quiet location. The staff, particularly those at the front desk, could not have been nicer or more helpful. Comfortable rooms with lovely good-sized bathrooms. Didn't try the breakfast--there were many options for all sorts of meals in the neighborhood. No reason to go anywhere else for lodging! Will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Met every expectation”
Reviews.Author: apriltraveler2010
Reviews.Content: We were caught in Europe for an additional 6 days due to the volcanic ash & had to find a hotel at the last minute in Barcelona. We couldn't have been more pleased with everything about it. The rooms were spacious, well appointed and clean. The staff was most helpful and the location was perfect. We were within a block of the Metro and walking distance of many restaurants and some of the main attractions of the city.

Reviews.Title: “If I returned to Barcelona, I would definitely stay at this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SkylerIrvin
Reviews.Content: The concierge was friendly upon our arrival, the rooms were very well kept and clean, and tourist activities and shopping were all within walking distance. the evening concierge also gave good suggestions on restaurants and evening activities and was also very friendly. When leaving, our train had been cancelled, and both the concierge and the manager had stopped what they were doing to help us, and got us bus tickets to our destination.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for a visit in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: Rarvis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on business before, but did not pay much attention to how satisfied I was. This time I was traveling with my wife and teenage son for a short vacation and chose to return. I am glad that I did. The hotel seems to have been reburbished. The public area was clean and well-lit and the room was clean. The location of the hotel is right in the middle of shopping and restaurants, and is within easy walking distance to subway stations of two lines and a beautiful part. We shall certainly return and recommend the hotel to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Room, Great Location, Most Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: djsjonline
Reviews.Content: Just back from 4 days in Barcelona and wanted to tell you how much we loved this hotel. In the city for the first time, Guillermo at the front desk was like our new best friend with restaurant recommendations, routes for walking tours and must see places. We prefer local non-touristy restaurants and he gave us his best neighborhood places. Not a lot of English spoken where we went but food words are easy to understand and it was nice to be with locals and not a bunch of Americans. He directed us to a Basque version of a tapas bar across from the main train station and to another little place on a tiny side street and we were the only tourists in both places. My favorite kind of place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: DandDAustin
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights and didn't take a single taxi other than arrival and departure because everything we wanted was in walking distance. The hotel staff spoke good English and could answer all questions so there were no comunication problems. The excellent rating was in part due to the hotel bartender, Javier. We developed a ritual with him of cava before dinner and then cava for a nightcap. He provided humor and a wealth of knowledge about Barcelona and the Spanish culture. Our trip to Spain would have not been so rich without our time spent with Javier.

Reviews.Title: “The staff make it delightful”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyPoozie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in an upscale area of Barcelona, off the Passage de Gracia. It fits the definition of a boutique hotel - it is small, quiet, well-appointed. The staff at the front desk were exceptional. They gave us great restaurant recommendations, impeccable directions, and were always gracious and accommodating. Even the bartender in the lobby became our "friend"! The hotel manager worked hard to make sure our stay was everything we needed it to be and he was also quite attentive, making sure to greet us all the time. My ONLY complaint, albeit minor, would have to be the bathroom. The marbled shower wall was mildewed in spots, the exterior of the bathtub was quite scuffed, and it is a shower-over-tub requiring a very large climb over the side of the tub to get in; it would NOT be good for anyone with limitations! Also, our toilet had a steady drip the entire time we were there and even though we asked three times for it to be fixed, it wasn't. That being said, I would still recommend this hotel because of its location and staff. Also, note that the restaurant was only open for breakfast buffet while we were there - never for lunch or dinner, and the breakfast left a lot to be desired!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, friendly Barcelona hotel”
Reviews.Author: Whitesox10
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Barcelona and we stayed at the Roger de Lluria at the suggestion of our travel agent. We had a great four night stay and would stronly recommend this hotel to anyone who would like a smaller botique type hotel instead of a large chain. The rooms were average size, very clean and nicely appointed. The staff, from the reception area to the waiters in the dining room, could not have been more friendly and helpful. The location is great, close to both La Rhamba and the nicer stores and restaurants in L'Exempla. We will definitely stay at the Roger de Lluria during our next visit to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: Glengracie
Reviews.Content: Great hotel complimented by very friendly, helpful staff. Ideal place to stay in Barcelona in heart of city. Hotel was exceptionally clean & buffet breakfast was excellent. Only negative was traffic noise at night but hey, it's in the middle of a bustling city & wasn't really a problem

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel , superb service, will visit again.”
Reviews.Author: ourfearlessleader
Reviews.Content: If they gave six stars for service then this hotel would get them all. Wonderful stay at this lovely hotel. The room was spacious and well appointed with the bonus of a balcony warmed by the February sun. The staff were the friendliest we'd experienced, nothing seemed too much trouble. Room service was available and happily delivered. The bathroom was luxurious and the bed big and comfortable. Excellent and varied buffet breakfast started the day well. Attention to detail was wonderful and the location in this beautiful city was very convenient- a short distance from the centre of Barcelona and yet not noisy at night. We will definitely stay there again when we return to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific-”
Reviews.Author: tasilo
Reviews.Content: - great location..even the street has the hotel's name - Friendly front desk staff..general manager introduced himself..this was very kind! - Roof top room was fantastic -Boutique hotel with old charm with new amenities Will return-

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, superb and a very personal service!!”
Reviews.Author: devsifamily
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent short break to celebrate a milestone birthday. Barcelona is tremendous and the hotel and its' staff was the cherry on the cake! Especially Serji Espinose and Javeri. Our room was very clean and comfortable with 2 balconies! It's only 2 blocks away from the centre and you can walk to most of t he 'Tourist' site. Excellent choice of resturants and Tapas bars nearby. We will be definately visiting the Hotel again-soon !! Devsi family.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dpayne1962
Reviews.Content: Good service and great local information from Christina at front desk. Most everyone spoke english. Our room was very clean and had a balcony overlooking the street and city. Very well located. We walked to most of the tourist areas. I had no problem with the wifi in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel -- has its quirks”
Reviews.Author: SnoopDogg09
Reviews.Content: First the pluses: It is a nice hotel for the price. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Location is great. Close to all the excitement. Now the minuses: Rooms are a bit dated. There was paint peeling in our room. Free wireless internet connection advertised is a joke. It doesnt work.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: photojunkie25
Reviews.Content: If you want a well priced, comfortable, quiet, clean and spacious accomodations with a big modern bathroom in a great location, stay here! Great toiletries too, included a toothbrush, comb and cotton pads. We walked to Placa de Catalunya in the safety of a good well lit neighboorhood in about 5 minutes. It was nice to be a few blocks off of the Ramblas with an easy walk anywhere in the main area. The staff we talked to were knowlegeable and friendly, speaking perfect English. Christine, Massimo and Javier were wonderful to us and really wanted us to have a good time. They recommended a busy but delicious local tapas restaurant near by for an early dinner. We had breakfast included, a buffet which had meats, breads,pastries, hot and cold items, juice and good coffee. Highly recommend to start your day. Try the Santiago almond cake which is part of their pastry table. I had it all three days. One day when I took the last piece, they brought in a whole new cake and brought it to my table! We even had a little balcony overlooking the street. Every night we took our ice bucket to the bar and they filled it with ice. Christine answered my questions via email prior to our stay with specific instructions for the last stop of the airport bus which is a bargain. About a 6 minute walk with luggage. We would definitely stay here again! We arrived at 9am, our room was even ready and we could take a little nap before going out. V

Reviews.Title: “it was amazing, wonderful, fantastic due to great staff, perfect hotel facility and hospitality”
Reviews.Author: MSRUYA
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my mum at Barcelona Ritz Roger de Lluria from Nov 14th 2009 till Nov 18th 2009. We were received in a very hospitable way by the reception specialist called Senior Rodrigo. He was very kind, friendly and helpful, He gave us great guidelines and assisted us in all our requests in an excellent way. The whole hotel staff from the hotel manager to the housekeeping was very professional, kind, friendly, helpful, hospitable and nice. We stayed in a luxury room and it was so cozy, so comfortable and fantastic. We had an amazing time at Ritz Roger de Lluria thanks to a perfect team that works to satisfy the clients in the best way. I strongly recommend you this hotel also due to the great location that it has. You are in the heart of city and have an easy access to the most frequented avenues. You can go easyly by walk to the nicest places. The subway and bus stops are just 1 minute to the hotel. For my next trips to Barcelona I will for sure stay in Ritz Roger de Lluria. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is the best choice because of the very kind stuff,location and very nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: ayhanbalim
Reviews.Content: It is a very good hotel very kind stuff,the rooms are very comfartable. Especially the location of the hotel is very near to all attractions.You can easily walk to the sightseeings.The hotel is very clean,and the stuff very friendly and helpful.Ayhan Balim from Turkey

Reviews.Title: “A lovely luxury traditional hotel, perfectly situated, beautifully furnished w/extremely helpful + professional staff”
Reviews.Author: CPPAtlanta
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exquisite in terms of location, hotel size (small), furnishings, room and bathroom size, cleanilness, extreme helpfulness and professionalism of staff, excellent food service, free wireless internet, etc. Our stay was perfect we highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Super Friendly Staff Ready To Help! Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: deuxnoisettes
Reviews.Content: Our trip was made even more memorable thaks to the super friendly and knowledgable staff. Cristina was THE BEST! Good location..not too touristy yet close enough to Las ramblas(which isnt all that anyway) and most sites were about 6 euro cab ride away. Rooms were nice, but be aware that when we were making the reservations on line,our first choice was a quiet room with no traffic noise so they suggested the rooms facing the back of the hotel, but the back of the hotel faces an elementary school yard which was very loud with screaming kids. Crisitna immediately changed our room overlooking the street with a lovely Julet balcony so that you can enjoy the sites of the city. There is another school directly across the street..but wasnt annoying. Walls are a little thin..we heard the honeymooners next door a bit! We didnt eat breakfast at the hotel, too expensive (25 euro)..walk down the street to a quaint cafe that has great hot chocolat and tapas for breakfast and late night snacks. The staff recommended 2 excellent restaurants to us that turned out to be our favorites..Botofumeiro and El Asador de Aranda. Barcelona is a really great, cleancity with very friendly people..especially at the Ritz! Enjoy. PS Take the double decker bus tour..worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel in a fab location”
Reviews.Author: Kaz97
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel for its proximity to the train station , metro and bus for the airport it exceeded all expectation. It also provided us with a room for four -2adults and two children (11&8)The staff were informative and polite. We were the only family and they didn't mind the children. The room was a good size there was plently of room , great bathroom which was clean with lots of extras. Breakfast was of a very high quality and although it was listed as continental, there was bacon, scrambled eggs and sausages. Adults and children thoroughly enjoyed the start to the the day. The hotel was placed in a quieter street but still in the hub of the sights and all transport links. It was an expensive stay but forthe three nights was worth it. If I had any negatives it was the lack of tea/coffee making facility/piped music throughout the night all though you got used to this. Had a great time and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: MaryJo21
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel in Barcelona. What I loved about the Ritz Roger de Lluria hotel was ...the friendliest staff at the front desk who were always so helpful and kind to us, the location of the hotel was fantastic....not too close to the busy Ramblas but within walking distance of it. In fact we realized that the location of the Ritz Roger Hotel was within walking distance of many great attractions. The hotel is also non-smoking, which was a relief! The room was quiet and spacious and the beds were comfortable. After travelling to other areas of Spain, I realized what a gem this hotel was. I would definitely return to Barcelona and stay at the Ritz Roger hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A very relaxing and comfortable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: total-recall
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Ritz Roger de Lluria on our first visit to barcelona. I am sure we will visit Barcelona again and we would also be delighted to stay in the Ritz Roger de Lluria. The room we had was spacious and comfortable, the breakfast had just what we wanted, the location was ideal and the service we received from the staff was excellent especially receptionist Cristina Sanz who from the beginning was extreemly friendly and helpfull. We would thoroughly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideally situated hotel for sight seeing in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: STB4JAB
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying here with my husband as well as his 88 year old father who had never visited Barcelona. Whilst a more expensive option, the single room supplement was better than a lot of other hotels we looked at, so we booked this and also upgraded our room to a delux in case we wanted a quiet sit-down. This 4 star htoel didn't disappoint and staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms had the usual courtesy items with a few extra not expected. Very central location, excellent for visiting either the old town or Eixample. Excellent recommendations received from concierge service and wouldn't hesitate to stay again or recommend to others depending on their travelling budget. We would prefer a wekk of luxury here rather than a fortnight in a lower rated hotel. Also has the option of spa treatments next door to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...wonderful room...marvelous staff”
Reviews.Author: adhocadvisor
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent suggested my wife and I stay at the Ritz Roger de Lluria during our 7 days in Barcelona in July. We're glad we did. Just two blocks from Passeig de Garcia and Catalunya Plaza, the hotel was conventiently located and an easy walk to sites we wanted to see. Along the way were dozens of restaurants and outdoor cafes to satisfy anyone's palate. Our room was splendid but not pretentious. The staff was magnificent. Hotel director Enric Garcia Arcauz has assembled a top-notch team that knows the meaning of "customer service" and goes out of its way to help guests. During our week's stay, Enric and members of his multi-lingual team, especially Massimo, made us feel like we were a part of the family, patiently answering our questions, explaining how to get from Point A to Point B, and offering suggestions on places to visit we may not have considered. The rooms were always clean. The breakfast buffet was an added plus for us. On a scale of 1 to 10, the Ritz Roger de Lluria Hotel of Barcelona rates a 15!

Reviews.Title: “Staff of the Hotel was absolutely the best I have ever Encounter”
Reviews.Author: Mars1213
Reviews.Content: They gave me the best tourist information on what to do and see in Barcelona i.e. the Picasso Museum please don't miss it. They even helped me book a flight to another part of Spain. The room they gave me was plush (make sure you get a double). The toiletries are some the best especially the toothbrush drop yours and try it. Best yet when I had an incident with a taxi cab driver overcharging they followed up on it. This the place to stay in Barcelona in a Spain where not everyone speaks English or is friendly to tourists this will be your Oasis.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: paulmarytomd
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Very close to all the exciting actions, yet in a quiet and safe neighborhood. Well kept hotel, nice room. Staff spoke adequate English and they were always very accomodating and helpful, esp. Cristina and Sergi. Watch out when you book, they might overcharge you for the room(as they did to us), but eventually had the decency to include the breakfast (which would be normally 18.50 euros extra) The breakfast was great in an elegant room. PD. Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Roger De LLuria is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TLSChicago
Reviews.Content: My husband, adult son and I stayed at the Ritz Roger De Lluria and couldn't have been happier with both the hotel and the service. The room was very spacious (plenty of room for 3 adults) and very clean. The staff were friendly and helpful but one staff member stood out from the rest. Massimo (sp?) was wonderful. He was so helpful and patient with us. He made our trip more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Not just going through the motions, but genuinely caring”
Reviews.Author: NLifeview
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in close proximity to all major attractions in Barcelona-Barri Gotic, La Ramblas, Passeig de Gracias, Picasso Museum, Gaudi masterpieces, etc. Since often times with convenient locations also comes the unpleasant side effect of hustle and bustle of a large city, finding a hotel that offers good location as well as quite and peace can be particularly tricky. Being nicely tucked away in a quite section of Roger de Lluria Street, this hotel sufficiently solves the problem. We found our room with a king bed to be clean and nicely appointed though the ornate wall paneling with gold accent to be somewhat dated. Concierge is knowledgeable and eager to please. Throughout our stay we never felt that we are just customers using the hotel to spend the nights, rather we felt as though we were being looked after by a caring host. On this trip we stayed in five different cities in Europe, and along with Hamburg Four Seasons, the service here was truly outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Visiting the land of Gaudi was charming...”
Reviews.Author: SparkDelhi
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Barcelona is located close to the middle of the city with convenient access to shopping areas, sightseeing places like the sagrada familia, Gaudi's restaurant and the Plaza de catalunya. The hotel offers great comfort with conveniences and amenities and is a good place to stay, the emblem is blue and gold and is well-kept and maintained. Definitely a good place to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Not as clean as one might want.”
Reviews.Author: rsm25
Reviews.Content: Not associated with the Ritz Carlton in any way shape or form, something that becomes evident upon arrival, but has a great central location in Barcelona. Room service lacked basic foodstuffs, like bread and ham. We found a dirty condom under the bed, left by a previous occupant, which we discovered while looking for our 3 year old's shoe. Management offered to send a maid to clean the room again, nothing else. Nice bathroom, decent size TV, cute little terrace. Pretty small room. Very thin walls. Good amenities, plenty of towels. Terrible, super-hard mattresses. One of the least comfortable nights I have ever spent anywhere -- and I slept in Grand Central Station once in the 80s. Did I mention the dirty condom under the bed?

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad”
Reviews.Author: Joethting
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite okay. The staff is friendly enough but seems a bit laid back. Communicating in english is a little difficult. THe room is fine. Clean and spacious. The location is about 5-10 min walk from the nearest metro. It's about 15 min walk to the La Rambla. All in all, I was quite happy with the hotel

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Roger De Lluria Barcelona
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Roger de Lluria 28, 08010 Barcelona, Spain
